loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Ms. Shamim is a 41-year-old vigorous lady. She has been in the general store business for many years. She started her business with a small toffee shop at her home. In the last five years, her business has grown to a reasonable level. She has three children and they all go to school.  Her husband also assists her by buying stock of goods from the market.  He is very supportive of her which is why she is able to give the store proper time. He feels proud of his wife. She needs a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy stock of flour, rice and oil to meet the time-after-time demand at her store. This would help her to expand her business further. Her case (loan) has been approved by the Kashf foundation.

loans.use: To buy stock of flour, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Israat

texts.en:
Ms. Israat is married and the mother of six children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a factory. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family, so Israat started her business to contribute to the family income.

She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and her customers like her work. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees to buy threads of different colors, zips, buttons, needles, etc., so she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy threads of different colors, zips, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en:
Ms. Shahbana  is 40 years old, has four children in school, and started a business selling clothes many years ago. Her husband is a government employee and has a very low income. Ms.Shahbana  works hard to provide for her family. She offers various designs of clothes in different colors. She is very well known in her community and has a good client list.

In her early married life, Ms. Shahbana faced many problems as it was very difficult for her and her husband to cover their household expenses. But after getting several loans from the Kashf Foundation, she improved her business. She has been associated with the Kashf Foundation for seven years and is very happy with its support. Now she is using a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy a wide variety and larger quantity of clothes to add to her current offerings. This way, she will be able to meet her expenses, and she wishes to use the profits she earns for higher education for her children.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety and larger quantity of clothes to add to her current offerings.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is married with four children. She is 46 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Teresa buys and sells rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Teresa has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase sacks of rice to sell retail.

Teresa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Teresa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 64 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City. Virginia is married with six children. 

Virginia has a store where she sells a variety of products. Virginia has had this business for three years. Virginia requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, sacks of rice, etc.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for one year and six months.  In the future, Virginia hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en: A rural villager from KrorKor district, Ban is married and a 36-year-old mother of two children. She has two hectares of farmland for growing her paddy rice as a core income generating activity for her family's sake. To add up more income, her husband works for others for a fee besides helping Ban on their rice field. It is the only business that she has been in for 12 years, earning about 12,900 KHR per day. However, her crop production is still limited when  flood hits her crop. As a first-time borrower for Ban's group, which is composed of two female members, Ban is the group leader. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 400,000 KHR. For Ban, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She expects to grow her crop on time, so she can multiply her income and upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash crop

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is 60 years old and a resident from a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother. To make a living, she has been selling various kinds of food for twenty years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save around 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Lack of working capital for supporting the current business is the main challenge.

Heang has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. The past loans, which she has fully paid back, have helped her to improve her living conditions gradually. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy spices for her food-selling business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the current business in order to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy spices for her food-selling business

loans.name: Chanthok's Group

texts.en:
Chanthok is a resident in a rural village in the KrorKor district, Cambodia. She has four daughters, all of whom are in school; sometimes they help their mum's business. 

To support her children in school, she runs a small stall selling grocery items in the village, and raises pigs at home. Her husband supplements the family's income by fishing, and reselling the fish. 

She has been in this business for 12 years. Chanthok's group consists of two female members, both of whom have been with VisionFund at least three loan cycles. Chanthok has used her past loan with success to inject more capital into running her business; she has already paid back the past loan. 

In this cycle, she is seeking for 1,4000,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fishing equipment (cast net, fish trap).  She will also use a portion to buy more grocery items for resale, including soap, canned food, instant noodles, etc. 

She expects that this purchase will help her support her business, so she can provide her children decent food and keep them in school.

loans.use: to buy fishing material and grocery items

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is 49, and married. She has two children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of the Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for ten years, and supplements the family’s income by selling porridge. The current business earns her around 50,000KHR per day and she saves about 20,000KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield resulting from flooding is the main challenge for her paddy-field business.

Yorn’s group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has successfully paid the past loan, which has helped her to relieve the family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now she and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,200,000KHR and 1,100,000KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm, and will use a portion to buy ingredients for her porridge-making business. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 39 years old. She is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 1-18. 
Amelita and her husband work together to raise their family. She is engaged in fishing, catching crabs and farming seaweed. She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed, a crab trap, gasoline, and rice for consumption. Amelita plans to expand her business in the future for a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy seaweed, a crab trap, gasoline, and rice for consumption.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is 51 years old, a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been involved in growing rice on two hectares of farmland for several years. The current business earns her about KHR 25,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs after deducting daily expenses. 

Chan received her first loan from VisionFund one loan cycle ago while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Chan's past loan has enabled her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of KHR 80,000 each. Chan, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice timely and fruitfully so as to improve her family living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 50 years old and lives in the community of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with 11 children, ages 11 to 30. 
He grows rice for an income. He wants his children to have a life quite different from what he has. He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor of men who will be helping in his farming. These supplies and labor will help so he can be successful in his farming and give his children what they need. The extra income will be used for his family’s daily needs and his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Crek's Group

texts.en:
Crek is 44 years old and widowed. She lives with her four dependent children who work in the family’s fields.

For the past ten years the family has grown rice on ten hectares of farmland. Crek estimates she can earn about 26,000 KHR a day from their farm, and she manages to save almost 2,000 KHR a day after deducting daily expenses.

Crek is a three-time loan client with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, while the other member of her group is a four-time borrower. Now she and her group member are applying for a 1,500,000 KHR loan. Crek is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and buy gasoline for machinery to help in plowing her field. 

Crek hopes for a generous and timely crop yield so she can sell it for a good price. She will put her profits toward making a better life for her family and herself.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and gas for farm machinery.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house, Phal is married and the 48-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are too young for school. For the past five years she and her husband have farmed rice on five hectares of farmland to support the family. She can earn about 18,000 KHR per day and manage to save around 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. As she is a farmer, the main challenge for her paddy is drought. 

Phal and her loan partner are first-time clients with VisionFund. She is requesting a 1,100,000 KHR loan,   100,000 KHR of which will go to her and 1,000,000 KHR to her partner. Phal will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

Phal hopes for a generous and timely crop yield so she can sell it for a good price. She will put her profits toward making a better life for her family and herself.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Vann, 24, lives in a rural village. He is 24 years old, married and has a daughter who is too young for school. 

For the past three years Vann has farmed rice on two hectares of land; he also grows pineapples. He estimates he makes about 27,000 KHR a day and saves 10,000 KHR after daily expenses. Low crop yields are his challenge as a farmer. 

This is Vann’s second loan through VisionFund and his loan partner’s first. Vann wisely used his past loan to improve his family’s living conditions. Now Vann is applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan, his portion of which will be spent on fertilizer for his farmland. 

Vann hopes for a generous and timely crop yield so he can sell it for a good price. He will put his profits toward making a better life for his family and himself.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz runs a small sari-sari (variety) store in Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. Beatriz is married and her husband works as a sales agent for a certain brand of food. 
They have two young sons ages 10 and 11 to support. Beatriz would like to help by making a success in her business. She is requesting a loan to buy items like chips, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and seasonings. 
Her loan will allow her to increase the sales of her business and start earning more for her family. 
In the future, she dreams of earning sufficient income to help her children reach their dreams through education.

loans.use: to buy chips, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and seasonings.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, a 49-year-old from Cabawan, Tagbilaran City, is married to a carpenter and has a seven-year-old child. She operates a sari-sari store to earn an income. 
Avelina wants to obtain financial stability, educate her child and have a better way of life. 
At this time, Avelina is requesting a loan to increase her inventory through the purchase of  items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent, chips and cooking oil. 
This way, she will be able to better compete with her competitors. Avelina believes that she can become a better entrepreneur through continuous access to financial 
services from lending institutions and adoption of new marketing strategies.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent, chips and cooking oil

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
47 years old Josefa is a resident of Bien Unido, Bohol where fishing is a common livelihood for most people.  She and her husband is into fishing business as well for 27 years now. They have six children to support through their income. Her eldest is 30 and the youngest is 12 years old. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy fishing net and nylons. She will continue to work hard so she can send her children to school.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business so she can meet the needs of her family and invest in another business if possible.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and nylons

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is 53 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children ages 15-27. Venancia is a side walk vendor who sells banana, cassava and spices in her town. She started this business 10 years ago and hopes to have more supply of vegetables to resell for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy more banana, cassava, onion and garlic that she can resell. 
In the future, she hopes to have her own capital so she will not resort to loan to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy more banana, cassava, onion and garlic

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun is a 61-year-old widowed mother. She is a villager from a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, To make a living, Hun has been in rice farming on one-hectare of farmland for five years as her primary source of income. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR and she manages to save around 10,000 KHR each day for her future needs.

Hun is in a first-cycle loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for US$ 600. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a tractor for helping her in the rice field. She hopes to receive a high production and earn more income from the paddy field so as to sustain her living condition.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies like coffee and tea to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marissa hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies like coffee and tea needed in her business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1992. She lives in Bac Ninh, the smallest province in Vietnam. She is majoring in human resources management at the University of Labour and Social Affairs (www.ulsa.edu.vn). Her course lasts four years and she will graduate in 2014. Hang is the first person in her family to have graduated from high school and to have a higher education. 

Her parents sell personal and household goods to earn a living. Her family’s income is about 10,000,000 VND. Her mother, Huong, sits next beside her in this picture, is also a member of SEDA’s credit program. Hang's family is her motivation and her support in choosing her major. She wants to earn a lot of money so she can support her family, improve her family’s living standards and also pay for her brother’s education fees. 

Hang plans to work in the capital of Hanoi or the province of Bac Ninh within the next five to 10 years. She understands that studying helps her to have the opportunity to get a high-paid job and to fulfill her dream of becoming a human resources manager. Hang wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay for her university fees, books and studying tools. This loan suits her family’s situation and income. 

The paperwork from SEDA has been fast and convenient to meet her needs. Besides lacking money for her education costs, Hang has other difficulties such as her living costs and transportation costs. Through this program, she wants to tell people that Vietnam is a developing country: they have an amazing youth generation but they are still poor and need your help to give them opportunities to develop their future. Hang appreciates these kinds of programs from SEDA and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees, books and studying tools

loans.name: Rozeena's Group

texts.en:
Rozeena is a 22-year-old hard-working house wife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband and son. Her husband is also doing a job in rescue 1122 and running his own mobile phone shop as well. This shows that he is really a hard-working person. He is the only person earning in the family. 

Rozeena, as a member of a seven-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase accessories for the mobile phone shop like mobile casings, chargers, easy load, keypads and memory cards.  And she wants to renovate her house as well.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for her husband's mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Virginia makes ice cream to sell in their community. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making ice cream.

Virginia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After Karangbenda village was devastated by a tsunami, their economic life was in very poor condition. All their efforts were destroyed. Their rice fields were inundated in the tsunami. With concern for the natural disaster of the tsunami, the "Rahayu" group was formed. Rahayu of group members there were 19 people, but only 15 members are to be borrowers. So, one person in the picture, one of the members who do not borrow., each having a different business including coffee shops, food stalls, food production and children's game rooms. The "Rahayu" group is located at the edge of the beach called Beach Srandil. With a loan from Kiva, all members want to raise capital to increase the types of food they sell, to supplement the contents of their stalls with snacks for the kids, and to buy more sophisticated tools for producing more Bandeng presto ( Pressed Salted fish).
 
The “Rahayu” group is led by a mother who has a coffee shop and a games room. Sumarsih is the leader and she has three children who are still in school. Her husband is a farmer. For Sumarsih, this means a loan primarily for her family and members of the group Rahayu. She hopes that with this loan, she can raise capital to complete her coffee shop and add more variety of children's games. Sumarsih also hopes that all members can live a better life and be more eager to develop their businesses. In the picture, the leader is raising her hand.

loans.use: To complete her coffee shop and buy more children's games

loans.name: Vinsensius

texts.en:
Vinsensius is a 54-year-old farmer. He has four children: Novalia, 24, who is married; Febrianus, 21, and Paulus, 19, who are both working in Jakarta; and Kristia, 12, who is attending the first grade of junior high school.

Just like many other farmers, Vinsensius relies on the season to cultivate his plants. Therefore, the income generated from farming is unstable. To overcome the lack of income during the dry season, Vinsensius also runs a pig-breeding business. 

Vinsensius is seeking to have more adult pigs to be raised in order to produce piglets to sell. Therefore, he has requested a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM to buy four adult pigs, food and additional zinc to initiate the pig stall.

loans.use: to buy four adult pigs, food and additional zinc to initiate the pig stall.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 41-year-old diligent and married woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband. She doesn't have any children. Her husband is a government employee. Yasmeen learned to stitch by practicing and working in different workshops. In 2007, she started her own tailoring workshop at her house to have a better quality of life. Yasmeen wants to invest some amount in her workshop by purchasing a sewing machine and tailoring products like threads, fabric, etc. As a member of a 10-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the profit, she will pay her household expenses and purchase some furniture for her house. Yasmeen's biggest dream is to have a large tailoring shop in the main market, where she will produce all types of products. She sends her best regards to Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Yasmeen is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabric for her tailoring workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy nails, rexion etc for shoe making and selling business

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
This is Neriza, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Neriza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Neriza dreams of giving her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Siningnessigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Siningnessigui  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Les quatre précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits, de céréales, de boissons, de pâte d’arachide, de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers.
RABA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente d’habits de toutes sortes(pour adultes et pour enfants). Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 douzaines d’habits pour enfants avec les grossistes à Bamako.
Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Siningnessigui group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 3 children. They live in traditional, extended family settings in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni town (3rd administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to friendships, neighbourly and business relationships. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are on their 5th loan. The 4 preceeding loans were properly repaid. The women in the group sell clothing, cereals, drinks, peanut butter, condiments and various other items.

Raba, the group leader, is the woman standing on the far right of the picture. She buys and sells all sorts of clothing (for adults and children). She plans to use her loan to buy two dozen sets of clothing for children from the wholesalers at Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, to her retail clientèle, made up of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Les quatre précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de friperies, de condiments alimentaires et de la restauration..
KADIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et qui a un foulard jaune à la tête, fait la préparation vente d’aliments de toutes sortes brochettes, friandises etc. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 sac de farine de blé, 10 kilo de sucre et 1 bidon d’huile alimentaire avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children. They mostly live in nuclear family settings in the Massabla Coura district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships, and friendships. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are on their 5th loan. The 4 preceeding loans were properly repaid. The women in the group sell items including second-hand clothing and condiments, and some are restaurateurs.

Kadia, the group leader and the woman wearing a yellow scarf on her head, makes and sells food including all sorts of kebabs and sweets. She plans to use her loan to buy 1 bag of wheat flour, 10 kgs of sugar and one can of cooking oil from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door to her retail clientèle, made up of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant majoritairement  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur septième prêt. Les six précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tasses, d’habits et d’articles divers.
MAIMOUNA, qui est la présidente du groupe est assise devant en pagne rougeâtre. Elle fait l’achat vente de tasses en alu, en thermos et en plastiques toutes sortes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 douzaines de tasses en alu et 10 douzaines de tasses en thermos avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of 4 married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 3 children, who mostly live in nuclear family settings in the Massabla Coura district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships, and friendships. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are on their 7th loan. The 6 preceeding loans were correctly repaid. The women in the group sell cups, clothing and various other items.

Maimouna, the group leader, is the woman sitting in front wearing a reddish pagne (colourful West African dress). She sells cups made from foil, thermoses and all sorts of plastic items and plans to use her loan to buy 20 dozen foil cups and 10 dozen thermos cups from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door to her retail clientèle, essentially made up of women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 60 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cups.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SABALI est constitué de cinq femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les deux précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits, de friperies et d’articles divers.
ROKIA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première assise de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de friperie de toutes sortes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de friperie avec les grossistes à Bamako et au Burkina Faso.
Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is made up of five married women who average 38 years of age with six children each. They live in traditional extended families, with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the Heremakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni (Mali's third administrative region).

They met each other through neighbors, friends and their businesses. In order to reinforce their financial capacity so that they can improve their trading activities, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their third loan. The two previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women sell clothing, including second-hand clothing and other articles.

Rokia, who is the president of the group, is sitting on the far right of the photo. She sells all sorts of second-hand clothes and is planning to buy two parcels of second-hand clothes with her loan from wholesalers in Bamako and Burkino Faso. She sells on the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisseme est constitué de cinq femmes (4 mariées et 1 veuve) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Dans le souci de renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur septième prêt. Les six précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pâte d’arachide, de céréales, de tissus des savons et de condiments.
KADIATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe  est  la première assise de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de  céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 800 kilos de maïs et 300 d’arachide avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of five women (four married and one widow) who average 46 years of age with five children each. The majority of them live in traditional extended families, with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the Massabla Coura district of the town of Bougouni.
 
They met each other through neighbors, friends and their businesses. In order to reinforce their financial capacity so that they can improve their trading activities, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their seventh loan. The six previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women trade in groundnut paste, cereals, fabrics, soaps and condiments.

Kadiatou, who is the president of the group, is sitting on the far right of the photo. She buys and sells cereals and is planning to buy 800 kilos of corn and 300 kilos of groundnut with her loan from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells on the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Kelegna est constitué de quatre femmes 3 mariées et 1 veuve) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur septième prêt. Les six précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe, de charbon de bois et de céréales.
RAMATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première debout de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois et compte acheter avec son  prêt, un chargement de camion en bois de chauffe avec les paysans agrées de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes à  domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kelegna group is made up of four women (three married and one widow) who average 36 years of age with five children each. They live in traditional extended families, with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons, in the Massabla Coura district of the town of Bougouni.

They met each other through neighbors, friends and their businesses. In order to reinforce their financial capacity so that they can improve their trading activities, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their seventh loan. The six previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women trade in firewood, charcoal and cereals.

Ramatou, who is the president of the group, is standing on the far right of the photo. She buys and sells firewood and charcoal and is planning to buy a lorry load of firewood with her loan from registered farmers in Bamako. She sells from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laïdou  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les deux précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de friperies,  de céréales, d’habits et du jardinage.
AMINATA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est en  deuxième position papier en main. Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales de toutes sortes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 tonne de riz avec les paysans producteurs de la zone de Sélingué. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group is made up of four married women who average 31 years of age with four children each. They live in traditional extended families, with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the Massabla Coura district of the town of Bougouni.

They met each other through neighbors, friends and their businesses. In order to reinforce their financial capacity so that they can improve their trading activities, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their third loan. The two previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women sell second-hand clothing, cereals, clothes and provide gardening services.

Aminata, who is the president of the group, is sitting second from the left with a piece of paper in her hand. She sells all sorts of cereals and is planning to buy a ton of rice with her loan from farmers in the Sélingue area. She sells on the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different tropical flavors and change the parasol.

loans.name: Raul Federico

texts.es: Raúl  tiene 52 años estado civil casado tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad .Raúl comenta que tiene años trabajando criando chanchos y luego los vende en su tercena de chanchos . Todo comenzó cuando a el le regalaron unos chanchos el los crio y luego los termino vendiendo y ese negocio le resulto por eso ahora quiere ponerse un criadero de chancho . Con el prestamos el quiere comprarse chanchos para criarlos y cuchillos y una carreta
texts.en: Raúl, 52, is married and has three adult children.  For years he has been raising pigs, which he later sells in his butcher shop.  It all began when he received some pigs as a gift, and later sold them.  Since that worked for him, he wants to begin raising pigs.  He will use the loan to buy pigs to raise, as well as knives and a cart.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise, knives and a cart.

loans.name: Heysell Lisseth

texts.es:
Heysell es una Mujer emprendedora de una comunidad del departamento de león, su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa y Zapatos combina la Actividad comercial con la Educación ya que imparte clases de un programa de educación de Adulto en su comunidad,  como bien es cierto a su corta edad  de tan solo 21 años; esta joven es un ejemplo digno de admiración, por tener el don de la enseñanza con sus prójimos y también aprovecha la relación y el tiempo para implementar la actividad antes mencionada ya que el salario de educación es una ayuda y tiene que buscar otra alternativa económica, es bien responsable y madura para actuar,  una de las necesidades importante de crecimiento de su negocio en cuanto a la demanda que Heysell  tiene es la compra de Zapatos, Camisa, Pantalones, Billetera de Mujer y Ropa Interior para incrementar su inventario y mejorar su oferta.

Por tal razón tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel, con el objetivo de ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y de esa manera lograr su objetivo de su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Heysell is an enterprising woman from a community in the León department. Her main line of work is selling clothes and shoes. Besides her commercial activities, she is also involved in education, she gives lectures in an adult-education program in her community.

At her young age (she is only 21), this young woman is an example worthy of admiration, because she has the gift of teaching her neighbors. She also makes the most out of this relation and of the time to implement the abovementioned line of work, since the salary she earns teaching helps and she has to find another economic alternative. She is responsible and mature.

One of the important needs for expanding her business regarding the demand that Heysell has is to buy shoes, shirts, pants, wallets for women and underwear, so she can increase her stock and improve her sales. This is why she decided to visit CEPRODEL's offices, with the objective of having the benefit of financing and in this way meeting the goal of her business, improve her condition and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, pants, wallets for women and underwear.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Ceprodel se caracteriza por Resolver las necesidades Familiares a través del financiamiento oportuno. 
La señora María es una más de las beneficiadas  con dicho crédito, el cual le permite efectuar la actividad planteada, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para plantear su necesidad, ya que dicho crédito sería utilizado en la compra de Sandalias y Zapatos, Actividad Anexa   a su profesión como es la de Maestra de Educación Primaria, dicha actividad comercial  la ejerce con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que el salario no le cubre el total de las necesidades del hogar, entonces buscan estas alternativas de financiamientos y de esa manera el  bajo salario lo vuelven productivo ya que las obligaciones financiera las paga con su salario y le da la oportunidad de abastecer su inventario de su negocio y crecer a un mas, ella es soltera únicamente con un nieto  a su cargo, la señora María  le agradece a ceprodel   por el apoyo que tanto lo necesitaba y la oportunidad misma de poder realizar lo que tanto deseaba como es de incrementar su inventario y poder  lograr lo deseado.
texts.en:
Ceprodel, via Resolver, provides for family necessities through timely loans. 

María is one of the beneficiaries of these loans. It allows her to carry out her activity. That is why she visited the Ceprodel offices to make her application. The loan will be used to buy sandals and shoes. This is for a side activity, since her profession is that of an elementary teacher. Her activity as a merchant is done with the objective of improving her condition and quality of life. Her salary doesn't cover all of her household necessities, so she is seeking these credit alternatives. This way, her low salary becomes productive because she can pay off the loan with it. This gives her the opportunity to stock her business inventory and grow some more. She is single and is raising a grandson. María  is grateful to Ceprodel for the support that she needed so much and for the opportunity to do what she wanted so much, increasing her inventory and achieving what she wanted.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Wilson Leopoldo

texts.es: Wilson tiene 46 años de edad estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela. Wilson es maestro constructor, ya que desde pequeño su padre le enseño este oficio por lo que ahora el trabaja haciendo lozas. El quiere tener  mayor capital para así poder comprar herramientas. Con el préstamo quiere compra: herramienta, soldaduras,  1 escalera
texts.en: Wilson is 46 years old. He is married and has 2 children who are in school. Wilson is a master builder. Since he was little, his father taught him this trade and now he works putting in tile floors. He wants to have more capital to be able to buy tools. With the loan, he will buy: tools, welding materials and a ladder.

loans.use: to buy tools, welding materials and a ladder.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María tiene  31 años estado civil casada , tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela .empezó su negocio hace años muchos años atrás  vendiendo varios productos, pero ella  siempre ha sido comerciante y le gusta innovar. 
En la actualidad ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingos de 6:00 am hasta 11:00 pm.  La meta de María  es que su negocio crezca, para tener más ingresos y poder terminar de construir su casa ya que su esposo es taxista y no le alcanza la plata . Con el préstamo quiere comprar para su tienda víveres como aceites, granos, dulces, confites, bebidas gaseosas etc.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old, she is married and has two children that attend school. She started her business many years ago, selling different products, but she has always been a saleswoman and she likes to innovate.

She currently works alone, monday to sunday, from 6:00 am until 11:00 pm. María's goal is to expand her business, in order to have a greater income and to be able to finish building her house, because her husband is a taxi driver and does not make enough money.

With the loan, she wants to buy supplies for her store, like oils, grains, sweets, candies, sodas, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oils, grains, sweets, candies, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 49 años tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de 19,22 y 24 todos ellos se encuentran estudiando, la Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de Dvds de música  en su puestos de venta que se encuentra en una populosa feria de la ciudad de El Alto,   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de un televisor para mostrar sus videos a los clientes, la  Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old. She has 3 children aged 19, 22 and 24. All of them are in school. Maria sells music DVDs at her sales locale in a popular market in the city of El Alto. This loan is her second cyle with the institution. Maria is going to use this loan to invest in buying a television to show the videos to her customers. Maria faces challenges in her business, such as the lack of cash to buy the products. She is going to use the profits to keep buying a variety of products according to the season. She wants her business to grow more and to help her family, because this activity is her family's support.

loans.use: to buy a television and DVD and CD merchandise.

loans.name: Jairo Francisco

texts.es:
El Sauce una bella ciudad con característica agro-ecológica está ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León, es un Maravilloso pueblo rodeado de una linda naturaleza, donde la mayoría de sus viviendas son fabricadas con ladrillos de barro y techos de tejas, se caracteriza por ser una zona donde se dedica al comercio,  como es el caso del señor Jairo francisco

Jairo Francisco es nacido y criado en este municipio con buenas costumbre, conoce a muchas personas que por amistad que tiene vende mucho en su negocio.

Empezó su negocio desde hace 5 años, vendiendo pastillas para mejorar la salud, hoy en día con el crédito que le ha financiado Kiva y Ceprodel ha logrado diversificar su inventario de medicina para el beneficio de sus clientes, pero debido a la necesidad de la población él está solicitando crédito para la compra de: Tabcin, dolo vitalgia, ser tal compuesto y entre otros que ayuden para el bien saludable de sus clientes. 


Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudan a mejorar muchos su negocio que necesitan de capital de trabajo para salir adelante y ser estables en su competencia y de la misma forma agradece por la atención que le hemos brindado y por haberle ido a ofrecer el crédito
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful agro-ecological city located 90 kilometers from the department of León.  It is a marvelous town, surrounded by wonderful nature, where most of the homes are made of adobe bricks and tiled roofs.  It is mainly a commercial area, which holds true in the case of Jairo Francisco.

Jairo Francisco was born and raised in this town of good habits.  He knows many people through friendships and sells a lot in his business.

He started his business five years ago, selling pills to improve health.  Now, with a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel, he has diversified his medicine inventory for the benefit of his customers.  But, due to the needs of the population, he is requesting a loan to buy Tabcin, dolo vitalgia, which is another health-care product for his customers.

He is grateful to KIVA and Ceprodel for their support with these small loans, which help many businesses in need of working capital to get ahead and become stable in their competitiveness.  He is also grateful for the attention shown him and for granting him this loan.

loans.use: To buy a medication called Tabcin, dolo vitalgia.

loans.name: Sonnia Maribel

texts.es: Sonnia  es costurera, tiene 36 años de estado civil soltera  tiene dos hijos que estudian  en la escuela.  Sonnia   comenzó hace 10 años con su liquidación de su ultimo trabajo. Se compro una máquina de coser  y de ahí poco a poco fue aumentado sus clientes con arreglo de ropa y confecciones hasta llegar a tener su propio taller de costura .en la actualidad ella se  levanta  a las 6:00am a dejar a sus hijas a la escuela y de ahí a las 8:00am abre  el taller ,el deseo   y anhelo de Sonnia  es también ser una diseñadora de modas . Con el préstamo ella quisiera comprar implementos como: hilos, telas, cierres, y otra máquina de coser  etc.
texts.en:
Sonnia, 36, is a seamstress and single, with two school-aged children.  She began her business ten years ago when she was let go from her last job.  She bought a sewing machine and, little by little, increased her customer base through her sewing and alterations.  Now she has her own sewing workshop and gets up at 6:00 a.m. to drop her daughters off at school.  She opens her shop at 8:00 a.m.

Sonnia's goal is also to become a fashion designer.  She will use the loan to buy supplies such as thread, closures, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.use: To buy thread, closures, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Rose Kwamboka

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old hardworking business lady, married with three children who are in school. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for more than five years and has employed three people. Rose had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business and she was also able to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of operating more grocery stores in different locations in the future. Rose has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy fruits, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a married man and a father to five children. He is 40 years old and earns a living through masonry work. He has been a mason for 15 years and people like him for his perfect work. He says that the major challenge he faces is that some of the people whom he serves are not faithful and therefore take long to repay the debt after working for them. He builds roofs, walls, cemented tanks, etc. 

Currently, some of his tools are worn out and therefore not very efficient to deliver the services to its optimal. He is therefore asking for this loan to buy masonry equipment like plumbing tools and a new trowel, among others. He wants to fulfill the orders he has received.

loans.use: to buy masonry equipment like plumbing tools and a new trowel, among others.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is a hardworking 30-year-old business lady and is married. She makes and sells doughnuts to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for three years and has employed two people. Besides, she operates a beauty salon to generate more income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management skills. Mourine dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Ms Pathani is a 32-year-old, spirited widow woman. After the death of her husband, she was in trouble to manage all the expenditures of the family alone. Six years ago, she started the business of milk selling to support her family. Being a single parent, she is liable to fulfill her children’s basic needs such as food, health and clothing. She is getting a healthy profit from this business and she is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She counts a good client list and her customers are increasing day by day. 

She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation so she requested for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy another buffalo to milk to meet the demands of her customers. She wishes to give a better future to her children and also wants to upgrade the condition of her house. She is hopeful of making her dreams come true through her efforts and determination.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo in milk.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: Antoinette is 56 years old. She has one child aged 27. She sells sorghum as a wholesaler. She wants the loan to buy more sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan, a 49-year-old married woman, is a mother for three boys. She has a small embroidery and tailoring business at home, making bed covers, baby blankets and pillow covers for sale. She has applied for this loan to buy more thread, fabric and a new sewing machine to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more thread, fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gilda Marlene

texts.es: Gilda tiene 28 años de edad estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos. Ella comenzó de a poquita mercadería  de ropa, también confecciona sabanas y también quiere un taller de costura su sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle trabajo a personas que no tenga ella trabaja de 8:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas
texts.en: Gilda is 28 years old, her marital status is married and she has 2 children. She started her business with a small amount of clothing merchandise, she also makes sheets and she wants a sewing shop. Her dream is to expand her business and provide work for people that are unemployed. She works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. With the loan she will purchase merchandise like pants, skirts and blouses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like pants, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim, a 36-year-old married man, is a father for two boys. He owns a small restaurant that he wants to enhance, and for that he has applied for this loan to buy some new equipment and renew the internal decorations.

loans.use: to buy some new equipment.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi, who is a 22-year-old young man, has been married for a short period of time. He is employed and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his cost of living. Currently, Shadi is finishing his house, but due to a money shortage because of his wedding expenses, some renovations have been stopped for awhile. So he is requesting a loan from Faten to continue finishing his house. First, he will install tiles in his house and then install new windows and doors. Taking this loan will enable Shadi and his wife to move into their house soon, before the Winter season is coming. He is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To finish his house by installing tiles, windows and doors.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal, a 44-year-old married man, is supporting a family of eight members. He is a sand artist. He draws with colored sand in different shaped bottles, and he can also write names for those who buy them as gifts.  With his talent he has participated in many art exhibitions and tourism markets. He has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of raw material he has and to get more bottles so he can participate in more exhibitions with a larger number of his works.

loans.use: to get more sand bottles and raw material.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 46, is a mother of five children. She is married and lives in  Congo Town. Her children are between the ages of 6 and 27. Three of them stay  with her at home and are attending  school, while the other two live outside the home and are independent.  Her husband serves as a security guard, 

Rebecca started in this business with a little amount that she had been saving.  She has been selling spare ribs, chicken, and pigs' feet in the market for the past twenty years. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business.  She has requested her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more spare ribs, chicken and pigs' feet to increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spare ribs, chicken and pigs' feet to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas offers fresh (buko) coconut juice within his village and nearby villages. He is a married man with two infant children. His wife owns an internet cafe, which she has run for seven years.

Jonas's coconut juice is marketable within their village due to the good taste, and it is used as an alternative medicine for kidney trouble and urinary tract infection. According to Jonas, he has another stall at Diffun Quirino. Three of his helpers manage his stall at Diffun, while Jonas is responsible for running his stall located at the Public Market of Cordon. He aims to earn a greater income so he can uplift his family's living condition out of poverty and educate his two children. For now, he struggles because of inadequate capital due to an increase of household expenses and rentals for his stalls. With regard to his situation, he requested a loan of PHP 18,000, which allows him to buy more fresh coconut. He knows that he could make his dream possible through continuous hard work, patience and dedication to his business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh coconut for his vending stall

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is 49 years old and married. She is from Bacolod, Ozamis City. She has five grown children who have helped her in taking care of her banana plantation. She and her family have been raising bananas for eight years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Lolina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to pay the weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay the weeding costs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old. He is a single man but he supports his parents. 

For the past three years, Peter has been selling retail goods such as jugs, cups, purses, sandals and albums. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy more stock of watches, albums and torches to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his sibling. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land on which to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watches, albums and torches to sell.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is from the district of Telavi in Kakheti. He is 23 years old and lives with his parents, grandfather, 16-year-old sister, brother and sister-in-law. His sister goes to a local school. Tamaz’s brother works as a distributor and his sister-in-law is a teacher. Both of them earn a monthly salary. Tamaz’s grandfather is a pensioner. 

Tamaz runs a small animal husbandry business. He has four pigs and plans to sell them during the winter season when the prices are higher for the new year. Additionally, he has a peach garden and sells peaches at the local open market. Tamaz and his father also earn a small monthly income as farm workers. 

Tamaz is a very hardworking young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

With the credit he receives, Tamaz will purchase pigs. He will place the pigs in a shed located in his yard, raise and fatten them, and then sell them at a higher price. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income, Tamaz plans to purchase calves and expand his animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a businesswoman who sells furniture and household appliances for cash and on credit. She started this business four years ago with a variety of products. 

Svetlana hopes to receive a loan from AqroInvest so that she can invest in more products to increase her sales. This is her third loan from AqroInvest. With this new loan, in the amount of 2,000 AZN, she will buy two wooden double beds. This will enable her to sell them to her customers at a good price.

loans.use: to buy two wooden double beds.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas en variedad,  tiene varios años de poseer el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ella es muy conocida en la zona  y comercia desde su hogar se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios realmente accesibles además de un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de las personas; Adelina es una mujer entregada a su labor, enérgica y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por encontrar las mejores oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en los últimos meses ha tenido aumento en sus ventas y quiere aprovechar este momento para realizar una nueva inversión y así extender el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas y bebidas por mayor. Adelina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Adelina is 39 years old, lives with her children, and sells a variety of snacks and drinks.  She’s had this business for several years and this has given her lots of experience and allows her to bring in better earnings.  She is well known in the zone, sells from her home, and has many customers because she always has what they need at good prices and provides good customer service.

Adelina is dedicated to her work.  She is full of energy and works hard every day to find the best opportunities for her success.  Her sales have increased in the past months and she wants to take advantage of this momentum by making a new investment to expand her business.  She doesn’t have enough capital, so she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL in order to buy snacks and drinks in quantity.

Adelina has a good payment record, is very responsible, and assures us that she will repay on time while maintaining financial security in her home.

loans.use: to buy snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 36 years old and lives in Tiribe. She is married and has one son, who is currently in school. Her business is selling fish. She has been in this business for two years and it is located in her home. She would like this loan to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to increase her income through this investment.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 30 years old and married. She is a mother of two children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling ladies' clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

Bilha was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. She is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 to buy additional stock of clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses and so on to sell to her customers. 

Bilha will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothing such as blouses, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 43 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Gema would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jewelry business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more jewelry to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for three years. Gina earns additional income from frozen foods.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and has five children. Three are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mila is 41 years old.

Mila has a food business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mila has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

NWTF is relisting Maria Magdalina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for repair of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and married. She has seven children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married. She has five children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Philip

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 13. All of them go to school.

Mary runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 1,300 SDG to purchase beans and many other items. Mary has no other source of income.

In five years Mary would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Mary says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like beans.

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Pima est composé de sept femmes (6 mariées et 1 veuve) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent  majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales, d’habits et de condiments alimentaires.
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe  et la seule assise, fait l’achat vente de céréales : maïs, riz, mil, fonio arachide, haricot, etc.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 tonne de riz, 500 kilos de fonio et 500 kilos d’arachide avec les paysans producteurs de Bougouni et environs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Pima group is composed of 7 women (6 married, 1 widow) with an average age of 42 and, on average, 5 children. They mostly live in nuclear family environments in the Massabla Coura district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships, and friendships. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better do business, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are on their 8th loan. The 7 preceeding loans were correctly repaid. The women in the group sell cereals, clothing and condiments.

Mariam, the group leader and the only woman sitting down, buys and sells cereals such as corn, rice, millet and fonio, as well as groundnuts and beans, etc. She plans to use her loan to buy 1 tonne of rice, 500 kgs of fonio and 500 kgs of groundnuts from the farmers of Bougouni and the surrounding area. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door to her retail clientèle, made up of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 80 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 42 years old and married. She has two children.

Trinidad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Trinidad has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Trinidad aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 27 years old, married and the father of two children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000. He is going to add the loan to his personal savings so that he can purchase another motorcycle in order to expand his business. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children. His goal for the future is to continue growing his transport business with a view of owning a fleet of motorcycles so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekadi, sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 24 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana chef lieu de commune de Guegneka, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de céréales, de parfums, de condiments, des habillements et du lait.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekadi sont à leur  premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso 
NANA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 7 sacs de patates douce, 3 sacs d’igname avec les producteurs de Beleko, N’Golobougou et de Massigui pour ensuite les vendre sur place en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
