Said is 26 year old and single. He runs a business selling typical Kenyan dishes, which he loves. Said is a hardworking, determined young man. His main business concern is to continue improving his food stall and earn more profit. 

Said is requesting his first loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, oils, charcoal, and beans. He is grateful for the opportunity to belong to the microfinance loan family and hopes his loan will make a significant change in his life and increase his market access and opportunity. In the future, Said hopes to own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, oils, charcoal, and beans

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a 33-year-old single female from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a 600 JOD loan to purchase cosmetics and accessories to sell to her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessories to sell to her neighbors

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 33 years old. She owns a boutique where she sells different items such as soaps, cooking oil and rice. She plans to get a loan to add more items for sale such as sugar and salt. The profits from the business are expected to enable more savings. She would like to have a stock value of 2 million Rwandan Francs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Dilbara

texts.ru:
Дилбаре 30 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. 1,5 года назад Дилбара начала заниматься организацией общественного питания, приступив к работе в кафе. Начав бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом, Дилбар смогла взять в аренду площадь в кафе в 32 места и тандыр (глиняная печь для изготовления хлебных продуктов) для выпечки самс (национальные мясные пироги).  Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Дилбар, ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дилбар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку оборудования - холодильника и витрины в кафе.  Доходы от кредита Дилбар  планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы в последующем выкупить кафе, а также начать бизнес в животноводстве.
texts.en: Dilbara is 30 years old, married and raising three children.  She became involved in organizing public food service by working at a cafe 1.5 years ago.  Having started the business with a sum of 25,000 som, Dilbara was able to lease a cafe space for 32 seats and a tandoor (clay oven for making bakery products) for making sams (national meat pies).  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, the monthly profit from the business now amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Dilbara requested a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase equipment - a refrigerator and a cafe display.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business in order to subsequently buy out the cafe and also to start an animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and a cafe display

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town in the southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of two and 14. Kadiatu lives in one room and in her shop with her husband and children. For the past 15 years, she has been running a general store where she sells soap, paste, cigarettes, and drinks. Kadiatu works every day from seven in the morning through 11 at night. Her husband is an old man who cannot raise enough income to support the family. Kadiatu's present business hardship is insufficient capital to run her business. 

Kadiatu is requesting a loan to buy more soap, paste, cigarettes, and drinks. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and have a permanent business location. In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a big house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy soap, paste, cigarettes, and drinks

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 32 years old. He sells potatoes and bananas. He wants the loan to buy more bananas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 25 and she is married with two children ages four and nine. Her children are currently in school. Bendu lives with her husband and family in Congo Town. For the past eight years, she has had a table at the market where she sells chicken and spare ribs. Bendu uses her profit to buy more goods to sell and also to contribute to supporting her family.

Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of spare ribs and chicken to increase her sales. In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: purchase cartons of spare ribs and chicken to increase her sales

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is 31 years old. He sells foodstuffs. He has been in the business for seven years. He wants the loan to buy more foodstuffs, such as beans, maize, and sorghum, to sell. The profits from the business will go toward savings and renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamed is a 42 year old married male from Jarash, Jordan. He has 6 children and has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for his home improvement expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en: Placidie is 39. She is a mother of one child aged 5 who goes to school. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She wants the loan to buy more sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 43 years old. She has three children, two of whom go to school. She sells clothes. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Remzie

texts.en:
Remzie lives in the southern part of Kosovo. She is married and is raising six children. Since she has lot of children and her house is small, she has started to build an annex for her house. To improve the living conditions of her family they had started the renovation--currently the children don’t have enough space for learning and sleeping. 

She is requesting a loan in order to renovate her home, buy shingles, gravel, cement and other necessary building materials. This loan will help to improve the overall living conditions and environment for her family. Remzie dreams to have a finished home to enjoy with her family in a healthy environment.

loans.use: To renovate her home, buy shingles, gravel, cement and other building materials

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 26 years old. He is single. He sells beans and cooking oil and he has been in the business for five years. With the loan, he plans to buy more beans to sell. The profits will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María de 56 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos en el municipio de Nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. Ella ha realizado trabajos de elaboración de sombreros de junco y también vendía pasteles en las canchas de futbol. Hace tres años decidió establecer una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, harina, pastillas, condimentos, refrescos, churros, pan, dulces productos de limpieza y otros. el préstamo solicitado es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va surtir mas su negocio de pulpería con productos de consumo diario como arroz, azúcar, pan, refrescos, dulce, frijoles, café, etc. con esta inversión ella va obtener más ingresos e incrementara  clientes y para lograr una superación familiar.
texts.en:
Doña María is 56 years old and has seven children. She lives with her husband and two of her children in the town of Nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. María’s work involves producing hats from reeds and also selling pastries at the soccer fields.

Three years ago, she decided to establish a convenience store where she sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, flour, medicines, condiments, soft drinks, chips, bread, candy, cleaning products, and other items. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with more inventory such as rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, candy, beans, coffee, and other items. This investment will help her generate more earnings and gain more customers so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, candy, beans, coffee, and other items.

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de leche para procesar quesillo y crema. Lo aprendió con una señora, con la cual trabajo 14 años en su negocio. Fue, así como aprendió ese trabajo, a elaborar quesillo para producir las pupusas. Cuando trabajaba con la señora era un jovencito, y vio que ese negocio era rentable, por lo que solicito un préstamo para emprender en su negocio. Actualmente todo el producto que procesa lo vende todo a un mayorista. 

El sale en un pick up a las 5:30 a.m. de la mañana, a recoger la leche de personas que poseen vacas, luego regresa a su casa, en donde inicia el proceso de descremado de la lecha, para luego iniciar con la extracción del quesillo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una descremadora usada. un amigo se la esta vendiendo; por que la que tiene ya esta vieja y deteriorada.  De esta manera se ahorrara en reparaciones, debido a que la descremadora que tiene a cada rato tiene que repararla, perdiendo tiempo lo que significa un atraso en su negocio. 

Él planea rentar un local en la ciudad, para vender lácteos, para que el  margen de ganancia que le queda al mayorista sea de él.
texts.en:
Jose, 36, has two children.  He has operated a cheese- and cream-processing business for 4 years.  He learned the business from a woman who had operated a similar business for 14 years.  She taught him to make a dairy-based product called quesillo, a key ingredient for making pupusas.  He saw that her business was profitable and decided to apply for a loan to start his own business.  For now, he sells everything he makes to a wholesaler.  

Jose leaves in his truck at 5:30 a.m. each morning to collect milk from the people he buys from.  He then returns home to start the process of skimming the milk so that he can make quesillo.   

Jose is applying for a Fundacion Campo loan that he will use to buy a used milk skimmer from a friend who wants to sell one.  He needs the skimmer because the one he has now is old.  He's lost hours of work because the old one is falling apart so the investment will allow him to be more productive.   

For the future, Jose wants to rent a space in the city where he can set up his own wholesale dairy business because, he says, wholesale sales are more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a used milk skimmer.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.ru:
Мубарак 56 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Мубарак в качестве дохода  для своей семьи, занимается торговлей продуктами питания.  Благодаря упорному труду Мубарак, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 15,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи.  Учитывая особую приветливость хозяйки и хороший ассортимент товаров, Мубарак имеет большое количество посещающих ее магазин клиентов, что потребовало участия всей ее семьи в бизнесе. На сегодняшний день в магазине Мубарак ей помогает сын со снохой, а также муж оказывает посильную поддержку.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мубарак обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку автомашины для оперативной транспортировки товаров в магазин.  Доходы от кредита Мубарак  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Mubarak is 56 years old, married and has six children.  To provide an income for her family, she is involved in selling food products.  Thanks to Mubarak's hard work, the monthly income from the business yields about 15,000 som (KGS), which serves as the base for covering the family's expenses for food and basic needs.  Considering the special friendliness of the owner and a good selection of products, Mubarak has a large number of customers visiting her store, which required the involvement of the entire family in the business.  Today, Mubarak's son and daughter-in-law help her at the store, and her husband also provides feasible assistance.  In order to further develop her business, Mubarak requested a loan in the amount of 115,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a car for timely transportation of products to the store.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her business in order to build a big house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a car for timely transportation of products to the store

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru:
Айсулуу 28 лет, замужем, имеет 2 дочек 8 и 6 лет. Айсулуу в качестве основного дохода с 2004 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 дойные коровы в приплодом, 2 головы лошади, 4 головы мелкого рогатого скота, а  также Айсулуу обрабатывает 4,0 га земли  с картофелем и зерновыми культурами. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 7,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айсулуу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айсулуу  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 28 years old, married and has two daughters, who are eight and six years old.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2004, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som.  Thanks to Aisuluu's hard work, today her business contains four dairy cows with offspring, two horses and four heads of small livestock.  She also works on 4.0 hectares of land with potatoes and cereal crops.  The monthly profit from the business amounts to about 7,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Aisuluu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities in order to build a big house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Peruvian artisan Miguel specializes in recycling auto parts and metal into beautiful sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of new tools and equipment to process the metal pieces for his art. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I'm a self-taught and impassioned artist; I was only a 13-year-old child when I began to make my own toys. I used to tear apart other toys and use their components to create my own versions. That's how I got into making sculptures, but this time by recycling mechanical parts. One day, when I was working on the sculpture of a medieval knight, I was missing some pieces so I went to a friend's auto-shop. He said I could take anything I needed from a metal box he had lying around. Three days later my friend came by and asked about some pieces he needed, which he had left outside the box. Needless to say, I had taken them, but they were already welded into the sculpture. I had to go with my friend to meet the owner of the truck for which those parts were originally intended, and explain to him they were now part of a sculpture. Rather than getting angry he was fascinated and bought it! He christened the sculpture, 'The Son of the Mercedes,' because those parts were intended for a Mercedes Benz."

"I would like to thank you for your continued support of my art. With this microcredit, I'll be able to continue developing my original sculptures."

Use the link below to view Miguel's recycled metal sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6243

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new tools and equipment to process metal pieces for his sculptures

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis trabajó durante muchos años en una fábrica de calzado, pero el dueño trasladó la empresa para otra ciudad y así se quedó sin empleo. Fue entonces cuando decidió con unos ahorros comenzar con su propio negocio de reparación de calzado y al principio fue extremadamente difícil dado el poco capital con el que contaba pero poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio y ahora lleva 25 años trabajando en su propio taller. Luis es la cabeza de su familia y de su negocio dependen los ingresos para sostener a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos, por esto siempre está buscando en mejorar cada día el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos. Como se acerca la temporada donde sus ventas se incrementan considerablemente, Luis busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como suelas, caucho, tela, entre otros y tener un inventario suficiente para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder continuar con este negocio y mejorarlo cada día para que su familia tenga mejores ingresos y así la oportunidad de gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luis worked at a shoe factory for many years, but he lost his job after the owner of the company decided to move the business to another city. It was at that point that he decided to use some of his savings to start his own shoe repair business. At first it was extremely difficult given that he had limited available capital, but gradually he improved his business and his shop has been in operation for 25 years.

Luis is the head of his family, so his wife and three children are dependent on the income generated from his business. For this reason, Luis is always looking each day for ways to improve his business and increase his income. The season is approaching when his sales increase considerably, so Luis is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as soles, rubber, fabric, and other supplies so that he will have sufficient inventory to respond to the requests of his customers.

His dream is to continue his business and improve each day so that his family will have more income and the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life. He also wants to have more financial opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy soles, rubber, fabric, and other supplies.

loans.name: Marianella

texts.en:
Marianella has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. She would like to buy larger quantities of the alpaca wool she uses to create her designs.

This is her story:

"You could say my passion for the textile arts runs in the family! One of the reasons I enjoy this art form is that it relaxes me. My designs mirror the convergence of different cultures and traditions, since my mother is from Trujillo and my father from Huancavelica. My life's journey has taken me down the path of education, and now I also teach. I love creating innovative styles and new trends!"

"Many thanks for your support through this microcredit. I plan to use the money to prepare for a great holiday season, and you can be sure you'll receive a quality handcrafted design created with all the love in the world. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Marianella's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5210

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of alpaca wool

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando, who works alongside his brother Luis, specializes in Cuzco ceramic art. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as clay and pigments.

Rolando has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"Our parents taught us to appreciate the importance of Cuzco ceramic art from a very young age," recalls Rolando. "We so wanted to help out that we would paint plates and offer them to our parents to sell, who instead treasured them. Our motivation comes from our admiration of Inca artistry and customs. Our compositions reveal the human aspect of this millenary culture. We describe this kind of work as art that breathes life into any setting."

"We plan to use this microcredit for a bulk purchase of clay and pigments, because when you buy in larger quantities the price decreases, enabling us to create more pieces. Thank you very much for supporting us this way, especially now when times are hard and we've been looking for a friendly hand."

Use the link below to view Rolando's Cuzco ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6678

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as clay and pigments

loans.name: Puriqwarmi

texts.en:
Puriqwarmi is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in alpaca and organic cotton apparel.  She would like to invest in the purchase of greater amounts of alpaca and sheep's wool, as well as cotton, to produce her new designs.  Puriqwarmi has been selling through NOVICA since 2006.  This is her story:

"Puriqwarmi is Quechua for 'Woman who walks, who moves' and is my artistic name.  It is how my father referred to me.  My interest in handicrafts comes from our own family traditions.  My father is 91 and he still creates artisan pieces.  My mother spins and weaves wool.  I am dedicated exclusively to textile arts, something I've done from the time I was quite young. I try to interpret pre-Hispanic design by way of my feelings, and transmit them through contemporary techniques.  I am very grateful for this microcredit.  It is an initiative that allows artisans like me in Peru to create more products.  That way we can participate in the market and be able to cover our needs, such as bringing up our children so they may have a profession without losing our family traditions."

Use the link below to view Puriqwarmi's alpaca and organic cotton apparel on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5550

loans.use: to purchase wool and cotton for knitting apparel.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is an artisan who specializes in traditional Andean retablos (dioramas). He would like to stock up on raw materials and invite other artisans to assist him in his workshop. Alejandro has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story: Andean artisan Alejandro creates retablos –- colorful dioramas unique to the Ayacucho region of Peru. Each tiny figure is shaped and painted by hand and displayed in a delightful tableau. "In every one of my works you can find the labors of my wife, who molds the characters, as well as that of my nieces and nephews, whom I currently teach. The customs and traditions of the Andean people emerge in every retablo we create." "I want to thank all of you who support us Peruvian artisans. In my case, I really need to buy materials and add more artisans to my workshop, so I can expand production and create new designs. In this way, the workshop I inherited from my parents can grow, and I hope my children can continue with this craft and surpass my own achievements. Many thanks." Use the link below to view Alejandro's retablos on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3210

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials and add more artisans to his workshop.

loans.name: Putu Oka

texts.en:
The son of a ceramics pioneer in Bali, Putu Oka creates handcrafted ceramics. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

Putu Oka has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

Putu Oka inherited his love for ceramics from his mother, Made, who pioneered Balinese ceramic artistry in 1980. At first, she undertook the entire design and crafting procedure by herself and developed a reputation for fine design and high quality. In 1990, when his mother passed away, Putu Oka took over her workshop and eventually opened a showroom in her memory. The award-winning designer finds inspiration in the luscious flora and fauna of Bali.

"I want to express my gratitude to all of you who have supported us with this microcredit. This is a really good program that can help the small workshop to improve and develop. It will also let us create more and, hopefully, sell more. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Putu Oka's ceramic tableware and decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2650

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a Ghanaian artisan who makes traditional musical instruments by hand. He would like to purchase materials for crafting his traditional African drums.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"After finishing my studies in general arts, I decided to get involved in art work full-time. I especially enjoy woodcarving – drums to be specific. I moved back with my mother and then underwent a three-year training period. Today I am a master craftsman training three boys in the art of African drum-making."

"I want to thank you who are contributing to this microcredit. Please know that I will put the money to good use to enable me to increase my work capacity. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Samuel's African drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2289

loans.use: to purchase materials for crafting his traditional African drums.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
SoloVida is a wife and husband team specializing in handcrafted beaded jewelry. They would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as terracotta, batik bone, and recycled plastic beads to continue production.

Solomon and his wife Vida have been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is their story:

"We are a wife and husband team working as SoloVida. We work with all kinds of materials from all over the globe, from traditional glass beads from Krobo and brass beads from Kumasi, to natural materials such as horn, coconut, bone and resin from Mali and Kenya. We also use trade beads that originate anywhere from Venice to China. It is our dream to establish international links and become known to the world of bead designers through exhibitions, exports, and training other jewelry designers. We hope to establish our own bead designing workshop one day, to create our own beads and supply others as well."

"Thank you for helping to fund this microcredit; it is of tremendous support for us!"

Use the link below to view SoloVida's handcrafted beaded jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6687

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as terracotta, batik bone, and recycled plastic beads to continue production.

loans.name: Otchere

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Otchere specializes in hand-carved masks and sculptures. In order to continue production, he would like to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as wood, aluminum plate, polish, paints and dyes.

Otchere has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"This skill of carving has been passed on for generations in my family. I was trained under the supervision of my father, who was also a master carver and very well known in our region. This art has sustained my family for most of my life. Like my father, I am a respected craftsman in my town and have taught a lot of young men over the years. I have two daughters, and a son who I hope to teach someday. Even if he does not pursue carving as a career, he can still teach his son in order to pass this family legacy on for generations to come."

"I am happy that you are interested in artisans like me, and I thank you for your support through this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Otchere's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8186

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as wood, aluminum plate, polish, paints and dyes.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is a master carver who specializes in Balinese masks. He would like to purchase larger amounts of wood to continue production.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"I learned to carve at a very young age. Handicrafts are becoming the main wage earner in my village. My experiences have led me to concentrate on carved masks. I learned to design from my father; this craft is taught and learned from generation to generation. The material I most commonly use is hibiscus wood. It has good characteristics and it isn't too heavy."

"At the moment I'm having trouble buying wood when I should be preparing my stock for the holiday season. I think this microcredit project offers us good opportunities, and so I thank all of you for your participation. Now I will be able to concentrate on carving and increasing  my stock. I hope it will sell well so I can repay the loan within a short time period."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's hand-carved Balinese masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3268

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of wood to continue production.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is an artisan in Bali who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures. He would like to hire additional artisans from his community to work with him at his workshop.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"My family has worked in wood for many generations, so my father taught my brother and me. Buddha, traditional, and abstract figures are my source of inspiration. Suar, hibiscus, ebony, and crocodile woods with natural finishes are my common materials. In order to make or create a new design, it takes me about one and a half months to refine my work little by little until I get the perfect design."

"At this time I need to hire additional carvers to help me prepare a stock for the holiday season. It's difficult to find good carvers in Ubud now, as I think we've lost many potential and talented carvers to construction work where they earn a better income than by carving. I am glad for this opportunity to get the microcredit; hopefully I can hire one good carver. Thanks for your support--it means a lot to me. I hope you also like my work so that we can preserve this art form and make it sustainable."                                                           

Use the link below to view Nyoman's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4566

loans.use: to hire additional artisans from his community to work with him at his workshop.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel specializes in handcrafted beaded jewelry. She would like to stock up on beads and stones for her jewelry.

Rachel has been selling through NOVICA since early 2012. This is her story:

"I grew up in the mountain village of Abiriw, in the eastern region of Ghana. Every year in September, we celebrated the Odwira harvest festival to give thanks. For me, the highlight of the event was the beautiful and colorful traditional attire worn with gorgeous bead necklaces. For ten years, I worked as a teacher of textiles and apparel. As a single mom, I started sewing for people to supplement my income, and went into jewelry making when a friend graciously taught me. My dream is to one day set up a school to teach underprivileged girls my craft."

"I am very grateful for your assistance, which will help me grow my workshop. Artisans like me hope you'll continue contributing in this way, as it helps us provide for our families."

Use the link below to view Rachel's African beaded jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8470

loans.use: to stock up on beads and stones for her jewelry.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia specializes in handcrafted beaded jewelry. She would like to buy agate gems and traditional beads for her jewelry.

Cynthia has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"I am from Aburi, one of the most beautiful places in Ghana. My husband carves African masks and he introduced me to the world of crafts. He dabbled in bead making, a skill he learned from his sister, and also strung beads into bracelets and necklaces. When we got married, he taught me. The initial challenge I faced was finding time to craft jewelry and also take care of a baby and a home. But my husband helps and encourages me. Today I make jewelry full time."

"I am very grateful for the support I am getting from you. I promise to use the money judiciously to improve on my designs."

Use the link below to view Cynthia's beaded jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7776

loans.use: to stock up on beads and stones for the jewelry she makes and sells.

loans.name: Ewurabena

texts.en:
Ewurabena specializes in handcrafted bracelets. She would like to stock up on materials such as wooden bangles and batik fabrics.

Ewurabena has been selling through NOVICA since early 2012. This is her story:

"Ewurabena is a Fante name that literally means 'Lady Abena,' and Abena is a name given to females born on Tuesday. My mother taught me how to sew and it came in handy when I had to put myself through school. I trained at a fashion school and I started designing and sewing clothes for men and women, using African wax print fabrics. I later developed a line of jewelry and accessories using swaths from the clothes I made."

"I would like to thank those who are contributing to this microcredit that will help grow my business. Your support is greatly appreciated."

Use the link below to view Ewurabena's handcrafted bracelets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8431

loans.use: to stock up on materials such as wooden bangles and batik fabric.

loans.name: Komang

texts.en:
Komang specializes in handcrafted jewelry. To increase production, he would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as sterling silver and semiprecious gemstones. 

Komang has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I wanted to create silver jewelry ever since I was in elementary school. By the time I was in junior high, I was crafting my own pieces, thanks to a friend's parents who are silversmiths. When I finished high school, I set up my own workshop and started crafting jewelry there. Creating new designs is very exciting."

"This microcredit project really assists artisans like me who are trying to expand their business. Thank you so much for your support, it means a lot to me."

Use the link below to view Komang's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7744

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as sterling silver and semiprecious gemstones.

loans.name: Zayd

texts.en:
Zayd specializes in sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to purchase silver in bulk in order to expand production.

Zayd has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

Zayd learned to design and craft jewelry by coincidence. "I wanted to create a gift for my wife's birthday, so I made a pair of earrings and she loved them! Many of her friends asked if I could make some for them, and that's how it all got started!"

"This time of the year there are many jewelry pieces that I should be preparing in anticipation of the holiday season. I need some capital to get going, so I think this microcredit is a good opportunity for artisans like me to ensure we have a good stock in time. Thanks so much for this opportunity and for your support. I hope my collections sell well this holiday season, and I hope you will like them."

Use the link below to view Zayd's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5371

loans.use: to purchase silver in bulk.

loans.name: Sukartini

texts.en:
Balinese artisan Sukartini specializes in hand crafted jewelry. She would like to buy larger amounts of silver to continue production.

Sukartini has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"I am proud of my Indonesian heritage. My mother instilled in me the values of a 'Balinese woman,' including how to prepare temple offerings, because almost every day is a ceremonial occasion here. I took courses in other traditional art forms, but my favorite is silver work."

"I need some capital to buy silver to prepare my stock for the holiday season, and this microcredit is a wonderful opportunity. I am glad for this support, as it means I can go on crafting jewelry. Thank you so much; I know this microcredit will keep my business going, and will also help me keep my team of silversmiths working."

Use the link below to view Sukartini's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4978

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of silver to continue production.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María Cruz  tiene la edad de 47 años, es soltera y tiene una niña de 7 años la cual cursa su primaria, la señora labora para la Alcaldía Municipal desde hace 12 años en donde se desempeña como secretaria de Dirección de Obras Publicas. Además de tener la profesión de Secretaria, cuenta con una licenciatura en Español desempeñándose como docente desde hace 3 años en la Escuela Gilberto Ramírez en un programa para adultos llamado ¨Continuidad Educativa Sandino 2¨. 
Es una persona con deseos de superación, ya que tiene el  anhelo  de estudiar la licenciatura en Derecho.
Desde el año 2007 se le han financiado créditos, los cuales les han permitido hacerle mejoras a la vivienda donde habita con su mamá y para unos gastos personales.
texts.en:
María Cruz, 47, is a single mother with a seven-year-old daughter who’s in elementary school. Maria has worked for town hall for the last 12 years as a secretary to the Director of Public Works. As well as being a professional secretary, she also has a degree in Spanish and has worked as a teacher for 3 years at Gilberto Ramírez School for adults in a program named “Sandino 2 Continuing Education”.
She’s a person with the drive to improve and wants to get her degree in Law. Since 2007, she’s been receiving loans that have helped her renovate and fix the house where she lives with her mother and for some personal expenses.

loans.use: buy paint and paint brushes to paint her home.

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en: Felicien, a 60-year-old married father of two, has been in the business of selling meat in a butcher shop for the past 30 years. Now requesting a loan to buy more cattle for slaughter, he will use the profits to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to slaughter and sell for meat.

loans.name: Khadejeh

texts.en: Khadejeh is a 52-year-old widowed mother of one from Baqa'a in Jordan. She has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. Khadeljeh would like to buy some furniture in the future.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Nonyem

texts.en:
Nonyem is an artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of new hand tools and equipment for her workshop.

Nonyem has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

"I was born to a Nigerian father and Ghanaian mother, so I grew up both in Nigeria and in Ghana over different periods of my life. I originally studied law, but have always had an interest in jewelry and been intrigued by the different techniques and very unique designs. My creative inspiration comes mostly from within, and also from nature. I use everything that catches my fancy and I particularly like to incorporate recycled materials in my designs. I am constantly seeking to do what nobody has done. I work with two permanent artisans, and I occasionally teach and work with young women who have dropped out of school and have no other opportunities to earn decent wages and be productive in their lives. I offer them a choice to do something with their lives.""Thank you for showing your support of my work by funding this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Nonyem's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6447

loans.use: to purchase hand tools and equipment for her workshop.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is an artisan who specializes in beaded jewelry. She would like to buy terracotta beads, agates and other kinds of beads for her jewelry.

Millicent has been selling through NOVICA since early 2012. This is her story:

"I come from a family with a long tradition of bead-making. I loved to sit at my grandmother's feet, watching her thread the old heirloom family beads passed on for more than eight generations. She'd hold out the strands when she was done, saying, 'My dear granddaughter, come and try it on.' They were always beautifully made. In 1994, I started designing and crafting bead accessories. It gives me great pleasure when I see my jewelry worn and appreciated."

"I appreciate your assistance. Thank you so much! May God bless you."

Use the link below to view Millicent's beaded jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8440

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of beads for her jewelry.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene, a 55-year-old married father of one child aged 14, has been selling cassava flour for 25 years. Because of customer demand, he is requesting this loan to buy more cassava flour to sell. Jean Damascene will reinvest his profits into the business and add to his savings.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Hojalatería Group

texts.es:
EL grupo solidario Hojalatería está formado por tres microempresarios activos y emprendedores en sus negocios como doña Ruth de 37 años que se dedica a la elaboración de sartenes de todos los tamaños y formas además comercializa ropa nueva de ambos sexos y edades, y vende y compra cosechas de tamarindo  es casada y tiene dos hijos quienes a la  par de su esposo le ayudan en el negocio, cuenta con trabajadores quienes provee de empleos a cabezas de familia. Este crédito lo utilizara en la compra de materia prima como metal aluminio, ropa y cosechas de tamarindo.
María del Carmen también fabrica sartenes, Eugenia Yamileth compra y vende cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en: The Metalworkers Group is made up of three small business owners who are active and entrepreneurial with their businesses, like Ms. Ruth, age 37. She makes skillets and pans of all sizes and types and also sells men's, women's and children's clothing. She also buys and sells crops of tamarind. She is married with two children, who along with her husband help her run the business. She also has workers, which provides employment to heads of households. She will use this loan to purchase materials like aluminum, clothing, and tamarind. María and Carmen also make skillets and pans, while Eugenia Yamileth buys and sells tamarind.

loans.use: to purchase materials like aluminum, clothing, and tamarind.

loans.name: Filipenses 4.13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Filipenses está formado por tres microempresarios emprendedores, uno de ellas es doña Ena que se dedica a vender ropa usada y ropa  nueva, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace dos años, las comercializa ambulante en el mercado oriental. Antes era ama de casa. Este nuevo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa usada en la cual ofrecerá más variedad a sus clientes.

Las otras integrantes son Rafaela Argentina que vende zapatos desde hace diez años, y Martin José tiene una línea de ropa al crédito desde hace 18 años.
texts.en: The Filipenses Group is made up of three enterprising small business owners, one of whom is Ms. Ena who sells new and used clothing. She's been at this work for two years, making her sales on foot around the Mercado Oriental. Before this, she was a homemaker. She will invest this new loan in buying bundles of used clothing, which will offer more variety to her customers. The other members are Rafaela Argentina, who has been selling shoes for 10 years, and Martin José, who has been selling clothing on credit for 18 years.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing (shirts, pants and dresses)

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia DE  32 anos de edad, casada con 1 hijo de 14 anos. La Sra. Es originaria del municipio de Nagarote, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente de país, Nagarote de destaca por ser el municipio que  fue declarado el mas limpio a nivel departamental. También de destaca por su comida típica como el quesillo, tiste y elaboración de artesanía. María Eugenia tiene por actividad económica la venta de quesillos la cual es una comida típica elaborada a base de tortillas, cebollas, crema, chile. La rutina de esta mujer trabajadora es levantarse todos los días y salir a vender sus quesillos de forma ambulante con una pana de alrededor de unos  40 kg de peso en su cabeza, bajo el intenso sol del día a día. Hasta hoy en día ha sido su medio de vida para sacar a su hijo adelante y aportar con los gastos del hogar. María Eugenia esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y compra productos comestible para la elaboración de sus quesillos como tortillas, cebollas, crema, chile, bolsas, queso quesillo. Ella agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a married, 32-year-old mother of a 14-year-old boy. She originates from the Nagarote municipality, which is located in the occidental area of the country. A highlight of Nagarote is that it was declared the cleanest municipality at the department level. It’s also famous for its local food, like “quesillo” (cheese tortillas), tiste (cocoa and corn drink) and crafts. María Eugenia sells quesillos, which are some of the typical foods of this area and are made from tortillas, onions, cream and chillies. The routine of this hard-working woman is to get up every day and go out and sell these quesillos by foot, with about 40kg of weight on her head, under the hot sun. This has been her daily life to raise her son and help with the household expenses. 
María Eugenia is requesting a loan in order to have business capital and to buy the ingredients for her quesillos, like tortillas, onions, cream, chilli, cheese. She is grateful for the help the Kiva investors give those with limited recourses and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: have business capital and to buy the ingredients needed to make quesillos (cheese tortillas).

loans.name: Yanci Adoracion

texts.es: Yanci Adoración de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella posee una librería donde tiene producto en variedad cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, hojas, entres otros,  además un taller de costura donde elabora todo tipo de prendas al gusto del cliente, sus puestos están ubicados en el mercado de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Yanci es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa y con muchos sueños que desea lograr, su mas grande secreto para llegar al éxito son la constancia y el amor a su trabajo sabe que solo así podrá alcanzarlo, ha tenido un gran aumento de la demanda y como toda buena comerciante planea acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuadernos, libros, lápices, hojas, tela, etc. Yanci Adoración tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Yanci Adoración, 25, lives with her parents; she owns a bookstore where she stocks a variety of notebooks, pencils, sheets of paper, among others.  She also has a clothes making workshop where she makes all types of clothes to customer order.  Her stands are located in the local market and she has many customer who prefer her for the quality, good prices and excellent service she provides.  

Yanci is a woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s active and has many dreams to reach.  Her greatest secret to attain success is constancy and love of the work she does and she knows this is the only way to reach it.  

Demand has grown much and like any good merchant she plans to expand the business and make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy notebooks, books, pencils, sheets of paper, fabric, etc.  Yanci Adoración has good payment references and spotless morals and assures that she will repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she’ll provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, pencils, sheets of paper and fabric.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 44 years old and the mother of two children aged  5 and 7, both of them in school. 

She has sold different items such as cooking oil, salts and rice for four years. She wants the loan to add more rice and cooking oil for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya is 38 years old and from Gaza. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Hedaya owns a clothing shop for selling clothes for women and children and for selling blankets. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and clothes, an electricity generator, and to install some shelves in her clothing shop.

She hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales and thus improve her income to approach her dream of moving to a bigger house with her family members.

loans.use: to buy goods and clothes, an electricity generator, and to install some shelves in her clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase lace material and polycottons for dressmaking.

loans.name: Margine Lizett

texts.es: Margine de 44 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos de 25, 23,16 anos. De los cuales esta bajo su responsabilidad el menor y en este momento esta estudiando. Ella es originaria  del municipio del jicaral del departamento de León. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de gas butano, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y además lo distribuye de forma ambulante en un camión de su propiedad en el cual transporta los tanques de gas de 25, 50, 100 libras a sus clientes que le solicitan dicho productos. Ella cuenta con una experiencia de 4 anos en el negocio. Negocio que surgió producto de la crisis económica del país y la falta de fuentes de trabajo fijo para que a través de este medio poder generar ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente necesita invertir en capital de trabajo  y comprar  a los distribuidores el gas para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.  Margine agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a las personas  de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Margine, 44, is married with three children aged 25, 23 and 16 years. She’s still responsible for the youngest and at the moment he is in school. She originates from the municipality of Jicaral in the department of León. She sells butane gas, a business she runs from her home and delivers the tanks by way of a truck she owns and that transports 25, 50 and 100 pounds of gas to her clients. She has 4 years of experience running this business. This business was created by the country’s economic crisis and the lack of sources of stable work in order o be able to generate income and help pay for the household expenses. Currently, she needs to amass some working capital and buy gas from the distributors to offer her clients and improve her income. Margine is grateful for the help the Kiva investors give those with limited recourses and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and buy 25, 50 and 100 lb gas tanks from the distributors.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María vive junto a su compañero de vida Antonio, sus hijos y su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces tradicionales, dulce de leche, de coco, de tamarindo entre otros tiene mucha experiencia  en la materia que le permite obtener los dulces mas exquisitos y con muy buena ganancias, comercia desde su casa y de forma ambulante, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Rosa María es una mujer exitosa, emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta en la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para la inversión, para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar leche, coco, tamarindo, etc. Rosa María tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa María lives with her life companion, Antonio, her children and her mother in her own house.  She works selling traditional cadies made from caramel, coconut and tamarind, among others.  She has much experience in this which allows her to make the most delicious candy and earn good profits.  She sells both at home and from place to place.  She’s acquired a large number of regular customers who prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices with good quality products and excellent service.

Rosa María is a successful, enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She’s always looking for new opportunities that will lead to success.  Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage of this and make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy milk, coconut, tamarind, etc.  Rosa María has good payment references and assures that she will be able to repay the loan while being confident that she’ll give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk, coconut, tamarind and strawberries.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 37 years old and from Tulkarem. He is married and has two children who study at school.

He owns a mini market in which he sells different products and food. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a display, refrigerators, and a glass door for his market.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and provide his children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a display, refrigerators, and a glass door for his market.

loans.name: Donard

texts.en:
Donard is a 32-year-old grocery store owner in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is married to Caroline and they have three children. He has been running the grocery store for the past four years successfully. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop for his wife. He hopes to have his own permanent residential house.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 44 years old from Gaza.  He is married and has three children who are in school.


He owns a shop for installing kitchens and windows from marble and granite.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy equipment, a cutting machine, and grinding stones for his shop.

He hopes that this equipment will increase his work and thus improve his income, which will improve his family's financials and his children's education.

loans.use: To buy equipment, a cutting machine, and grinding stones for his shop.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Don Lázaro es un  hombre tejedor de 26 años de edad, casado la cual vive en Sololá con su esposa y sus tres hijos, dos mujeres de 5 y 3 años de edad y un varón de  6 meses de nacido.
El se dedica al tejido artesanal en su residencia la cual cuenta con dos telares donde coloca el hilo para elaborar telas típicas llamadas (CHALINAS) para venderlas en diferentes lugares y departamentos, trabajando conjuntamente con su esposa ya que es la primer fuente de ingresos  económicos para su familia.
El aprendió este trabajo con sus abuelos desde que el estudiaba el nivel básico en la escuela y luego el decidió realizar su propio negocio viendo que las ganancias son buenas. 
El empezó a realizar su propio  negocio desde hace 5 años, ahora el ve que le va bien y necesita mas materia prima pero no cuenta con el capital en efectivo así que el solicita un préstamo de                           Q 4,000.00 para comprar hilo tipo lana que utilizara para realizar mas tejidos.
Entre el y su esposa sueñan con seguir capitalizando su negocio y tener mas telares y sacar mas producción de telas típicas así también darle los mejores estudios académicos a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Don Lázaro is a 26-year-old gentleman who earns his living as a weaver. He is married and lives in Sololá with his wife and three children, two daughters (ages 5 and 3) and a six-month-old son.

Since he weaves for a living, Lázaro has two looms in his home that he uses to make traditional fabrics called “chalinas”. These are sold in different places and departments within the country. Lázaro and his wife work together and this trade is the primary source of income for their family. He learned this line of work from his grandparents. Lázaro received a basic school education and later decided to start his own business so that he could earn a good income. His business was started five years ago and now he has done very well.

He is need of more raw materials, but he does not have capital on hand. For this reason, Lázaro is requesting a loan of 4,000 GTQ to buy wool thread so that he can produce more woven fabrics. He and his wife dream of continuing to build up more capital in their business, acquiring more looms, and producing more traditional fabrics. They also want to provide their daughters with a better education.

loans.use: to buy wool thread for making traditional woven fabrics.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa camisas, pantalones, vestidos entre otros, y para complementar los gastos del hogar vende paletas de diferentes sabores , tiene varios con el pequeño negocio y eso le regalo experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y en forma ambulante, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; Carmelina es una mujer dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran el camino al éxito, como toda comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio por eso  le solicita a INTEGRAL ropa por mayor y paletas. Carmelina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará en su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmelina, 44, lives with her daughter.  She sells clothes like shirts, pants and dresses, among others.  To add to household income she also sells frozen pops in assorted flavors.  She’s had her small business for several years and has acquired sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits.  She sells both at home and from place to place and has acquired a large clientele because people know that everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices and with excellent service.

Carmelina is a woman who is an enterprising and dedicated to her work; she very much wants to get ahead and is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will open the path to success.  Like all good merchants, she wants to expand her business and this is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy clothes at wholesale and to buy frozen pops.  Carmelina has good payment references and spotless morals; she assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan while trusting that she will be able to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale and to buy frozen pops.

loans.name: Chidodo

texts.en:
Chidodo lives in a suburb of Samburu.  She has three children for whom she strives tirelessly to provide with a life of dignity that’s free from want. 

She operates a meat goat business, buying and selling goats at the market. She’s worked with her family for more than two years.

Chidodo is asking for the loan to buy more goats for sale. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because thanks to it, she will be able to stay in business supporting herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras de éxito como Ana del Socorro vende nacatamales y comida variada los fines de semanas en su domicilio  esta  actividad la viene realizando desde hace 15 años. Lo inicio sola forjada con sus hijos produciendo comida en menor escala. Este crédito lo quiere invertir en otros  productos para diversificar su negocio como la compra de productos plásticos como tinas plásticas, baldes, platos etc.

Maria  de la Luz vende enchiladas, pinolillo, arroz con leches, Ivania vende comida los fines de semanas en su casa, Dora Antonia tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group is made up of four successful entrepreneurs, including Anna del Socorro. On weekends, she sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and a variety of food from her home. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years. She started it on her own, together with her children, producing food on a small scale. 

She wants to use the loan to buy other products, in order to diversify her business by purchasing plastic products such as plastic washtubs, pails, plates, etc.

Maria de la Luz sells enchiladas, pinolillo (cornmeal and cocoa beverage), and rice pudding. Ivania sells food on weekends from her home. Dora Antonia has a small general store.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies, such as pork, leaves, spices, rice, firewood, perishables, etc.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo, 49, is a single mother with two children, aged 4 and 12, who are presently in school and live with her in Congo Town. Korpo has been involved in this business for the past six years--she sells coal, by retail, in her community. Her favorite part of her business is the way her customers respond to her business. With the profit generated from the business ,she buy more goods to sell and attends to the needs of her children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of coal for resale. She plans to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of coal for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is applying for her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more cows for slaughter to be able to supply more meat to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her butcher shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 29 years old business lady who sells secondhand clothes in Mombasa. She is a married mother of one child. She has been running a second hand clothing retail stall for the last seven years and she is doing great. 

This will be her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her child. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to resell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of six and owns a green grocery stall, which she has been operating for five years. In this business, Julia sells greens, fruits, vegetables, etc. She began the business from her savings.
Julia learned about Milango through a friend. She is hoping to access credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock, and seasonal business climate.
Julia is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a father of four children, three of whom attend school. He owns a secondhand clothing shop, a business he has been operating for ten years.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him, and he joined a group with the goal of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is insufficient monitoring of the business.
Willy is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings (KES) to expand his business by buying clothes for the business. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his siblings. His plan for the future is to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 40 years old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. He is married to Monica. He has been doing this business for the past six years with great success. 

David was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for his shop. 


He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and the gradual expansion of his shop. He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders

loans.name: Tariro Group

texts.en:
Ellen is a woman aged 54 and she lives in Mufakose. She has 4 children and 1 attends school. 

For the last 3 years, Ellen has been operating a stall at a flea market where she sells clothes and school uniforms. The problem she faces in her business has poor shelter at the market.

Ellen is is requesting for a loan of $500 to replenish her stocks. She expects to have a bigger business, selling a variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Josselyn Raquel

texts.es: Joselyn Raquel de veinte años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella posee un comedor en el lugar en su residencia y prepara variedad de platillos sopas, carnes, arroz, ensaladas, bebidas entre otros, además vende frutas y verduras para complementar los gastos del hogar, tiene varios años con el negocio y le da muy buenos resultados, ha ganado mucha experiencia y excelentes ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy transitado y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren porque siempre posee lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de las personas; Joselyn es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y luchadora es todo un ejemplo a seguir, todos los días trabaja con gran esfuerzo porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto desea, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión que le permita comprar materia prima carnes, granos básicos, verduras, frutas, bebidas etc. Joselyn Raquel tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, segura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza de ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Joselyn Raquel, 20, lives with her parents.  She has an eatery at home where she prepares a variety of dishes like soups, meats, rice, salad and beverages, among others.  To add to household income she also sells fruit and vegetables.  She’s been in business several years and it produces good results.  She’s gained much experience and excellent profits.  The place where she sells is very busy and she has many customers who prefer her because she always has what they need with quality products at affordable prices and unequalled service; she’s always at people’s disposal.

Joselyn is an energetic, tenacious woman who is very dedicated to her work; she sets quite a good example.  She works every day with much effort because she knows that this is the only way to attain the success she so desires.

Demand has increased in recent months and like all good merchants she wants to increase business and make a new investment that will allow her to buy raw materials like meats, basic grains, vegetables, fruit, beverages, etc.  Joselyn has good payment references and is responsible.  She assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan and at the same time hopes to provide her family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, vegetables, fruit and beverages.

loans.name: Ana Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana Lidia de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida sus hijos y su madre en casa propia; ella posee un comedor y prepara platillos en variedad sopas, carnes, arroz, ensaladas, pupusas, bebidas entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y ya posee amplia experiencia en la cocina lo cual le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su vivienda la cual esta ubicada en una zona muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque sus platillos son los mas exquisitos, elaborados con materia prima de calidad e higiene, con precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Ana es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor siempre esta buscando alternativas que le den la oportunidad de encontrar el mejor camino al éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo, quiere realizar una nueva inversión para poder aumentar su producción pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carne, lácteos, verduras, etc., además la reparación de plancha para pupusas. Ana lidia tiene buenas referencias de pago, se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Lidia, 57, lives with her life companion, their children and her mother in her own house.  She has a restaurant wherein she prepares a variety of dishes: soups, meats, rice, salads, pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] and beverages, among others.   She’s been in business for several years and has wide experience cooking which allows her to earn the best profits.  She sells from home which is located in a very busy area.  She’s acquired a large number of regular customers who prefer her because her dishes are the most delicious and they are made with quality raw materials under hygienic conditions.  Prices are affordable and, above all, service is excellent.

Ana is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s always on the lookout for alternatives that will give her the opportunity of finding the best path to success and she will not rest until she reaches it.

She wants to make a new investment to increase production but needs capital to back her up which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products, vegetables, etc. as well as to repair the pupusa grill.  Ana has good payment references and she accepts the responsibility of the debt while at the same time has faith that she will provide economic security for her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, tres hijos menores de edad y su madre. Ella se dedica a la venta de fritada, la cual es una comida típica de este país que está conformada por diferentes partes del cerdo, esta la comercializa de forma ambulante y diferentes colonias y mercados. A pesar que es un platillo típico poco común, cuenta con gran número de clientes. Rosa solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar cerdos para criarlos ella misma, y así reproducirlos y preparar la fritada a precios más bajos. El mayor deseo de Rosa es poder vivir mejor, darles todo lo necesario a sus familia.
texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and lives with her husband, her three young children, and her mother.  She makes a living selling fritadas, a dish that is typical of El Salvador, and which is made from various parts of the pig.  She sells her fritadas as a street vendor in different neighborhoods and markets.  Although fritadas are a typical dish, they are not sold very commonly, and so she has a large number of customers.  Rosa is asking INTEGRAL for a loan, which she will use to purchase pigs that she can raise and breed—this will allow her to prepare her fritadas at lower prices.  Rosa’s greatest wish is to be able to live better and provide her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and butcher in order to make fritadas.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María Ester de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Alberto y sus hijos; Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, pan, huevos, leche, embutidos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas lo cual le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su residencia en una localidad muy transitada de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela pero sus mejores clientes son los vecinos quienes la recomiendan porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es el esfuerzo y el amor al trabajo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar la inversion por eso le solcita a INTEGRAL un credito que le ermita comprar granos basicos, leche, huevos, embutidos.María Ester tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Ester, age 47, lives with her life partner and their children. She owns a small store where she sells daily necessity items like bread, eggs, milk,and cold cuts, among others. She's been running this business for many years, which has given her a lot of experience in sales that allows her to generate the best profits she can. The store is located in her home in at a location with a lot of foot traffic. She already has a lot of customers, but her best clients are her neighbors, who recommend her because she always has what they need, quality products at affordable prices, and with excellent service.     

María is an enterprising woman very dedicated to her work and who has many goals that she aims to achieve. Her biggest secret to achieving success is effort and a love of work. In recent weeks, demand has been increasing and she would like to take advantage. That's why she's requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] that will allow her to buy basic items like milk, eggs, and deli meats. María Ester has a good payment history and is very responsible. She is certain that she will be able to pay off the loan and is confident that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic items like milk, eggs, and deli meats.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict lives in the Mariakani branch of Coastal Province. He is single and has been operating a ‘dhobi’ cleaning service, specializing in clothes. He began the business from his savings with which he purchased basins and iron boxes and rented a business space. 
A loan of 21,050 KES will help Benedict purchase a dry cleaning machine which will increase the speed of his service delivery and improve his efficiency at work.
Benedict plans to open a chemical cleaning business and cites lack of funds and a little competition as the challenges to overcome. He also intends to buy more cleaning supplies and rent a larger business space in future. He appreciates the partnership with Milango and feels this is the best option for his financial needs.

loans.use: to buy a dry cleaning machine.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-age children. She owns a clothing business which she has been operating for five years. She also sells detergents.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds. 
Patricia is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en:
Jamali lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of three children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for two years. In this shop, Jamali sells assorted retail products, e.g., tea leaves, sugar, salt, flour, soaps, etc. He began the business from an informal savings scheme called "merry-go-round," a process where individuals contribute money and lend the sum to one person at a time.
He learned about Milango through a friend. His goal is to access credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is that some customers do not pay on time.
Jamali is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings (KES) to build a house. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the standard of living of his family. His plan for the future is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Nengah

texts.en:
