Nengah is a Balinese artisan who makes woven grass handbags, baskets, and trays. He would like to stock up on the natural fibers he uses to weave, and also to help with workshop costs.

Nengah has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"My mother is a senior 'ate' grass weaver in our village. My grandfather taught me to print Balinese handwriting on palm leaves as well as to carve images on this leaf. When demand grew for 'ate' products, I saw it as a challenge to learn how to make these too. Weaving this durable island grass is not as hard as people may think, but it's not easy work either. One needs a lot of patience to weave one tiny piece of 'ate' into a basket or bag."

"I find these microcredit loans very useful, and they help artisans like me in many ways. I hope that, with your support, my sales will increase. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nengah's handwoven ate grass handbags and other items on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3687

loans.use: to stock up on the natural fibers he uses to weave, and also to help with workshop costs.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has two children in school.

Ronald owns a motorcycle repair garage--a business he began six years ago. After being introduced to Milango by his friends, Nickson is now applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan Shillings to purchase spare parts to use for vehicle repairs.

The business has many customers due to the fact that there are few specialized mechanics for motorcycles and three-wheelers, and because many clients prefer to work with trusted mechanics.

Nickson faces the challenge of lack of capital to purchase a supply of spare parts. He looks forward to opening other centers in future. He will use the extra income to cater to the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в Варзобском районе. Ему 23 года. Хуршед женат. Он три года как предоставляет услугу, такси. Он предоставляет услугу по маршруту Варзоб - Душанбе. Хуршед просит кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the Varzob region. He is 23 years old and married. For the past three years, he has been providing taxi services. He covers the route from Varzob to Dushanbe. Khurshed is seeking a loan so that he can repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-age children. She operates a cosmetics shop, a business that she has been operating for four years. The family also has some income from her husband’s employment.
Racheal learned about Milango through a friend. He goal is to access credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is inflation.
Racheal is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy hair chemicals, creams, and other beauty products. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve the living standard of her life and also pay for her children’s school fees. She aspires to open other branches in future.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, creams, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Wahyu is a Balinese artisan who makes handcrafted batik handbags and totes. She would like to buy fabric, beads, and materials in quantity for her handcrafted batik handbags.

Wahyu has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"I work in Java's legendary batik art. I'm always keen to learn new things and new techniques. My family taught me that I must work hard to succeed in life. Now I am married and we have a lovely daughter. In my small batik workshop, I specialize in handbags, cushion covers and table runners, and add details with beads. My products might take longer to finish because of the hand-sewn beaded details, but I am always satisfied with the end result."


"I need capital to order batik and beads for my designs, and I got this chance to request a loan from you. What a nice surprise and a big help for me! Thank you so much for your support and trust. With the holidays coming, I hope that sales will increase. This will help me to build my small home business."

Use the link below to view Wahyu's beaded batik handbags and totes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8545

loans.use: to buy fabric, beads, and materials in quantity for her handcrafted batik handbags.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and owns a barber shop, which has been in operation for almost two years. He began the business from money he saved over a long period of time. Apart from this, he also owns a salon.
George is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy additional stock of cosmetics, shavers, and other business equipment. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. Although the business faces the challenge of competition, George believes that the addition of these new machines will help improve his sales.
His ambition is to open other barber shops.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cosmetics, shaver,s and other business equipment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: This is 52-year-old Mary. She is married and has 2 children aged 29 and 15. In 1998, Mary established her charcoal and palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to take good care of her children. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mary now requires a new loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal and palm oil. In the future, Mary plans to establish more business outlets and build her own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and palm oil.

loans.name: Dufashanye Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne fait partie du groupe Dufashanye  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à  Pierre,  un éleveur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de 3 à  8 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce de beignets  depuis  5ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  la quantité de beignets à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce  aux bénéfices de son commerce, elle nourrit ses enfants, les  habille et les fait soigner. Elle a aussi acheté une parcelle pour eux.
texts.en:
Joselyne is a member of the Dufashanye group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and is married to Pierre, a stockbreeder. Together they have 4 children, aged 3 to 8 years old. 

Joselyne has been selling beignets for 5 years. 

She is on her fourth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase the amount of beignets [she] resells to earn more. 

Thanks to the earnings from this business, Joselyne feeds, clothes, and takes care of her children. She also bought a plot of land for them.

loans.use: to increase the amount of beignets [she] resells

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 40 years old and married. She is a hard-working mother and has been managing her business for the past ten years. She has four children, ranging in age from 4 to 22: two of whom stay at home with her, while the other two live outside of the home and are independent.

Oretha sells rice, cooking oil, candy, biscuits, milk, hand and bath soap, and many other items at the local market. Before getting into the business, Oretha started out as a house maid. She is proud of her business because, with the profits generated, she will take care of her children's needs and will buy more goods to improve the business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, cooking oil, candy, biscuits and bath soap for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil, candy, biscuits and bath soap for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province. He is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. He owns a detergent manufacturing shop and has been operating it for three years. Apart from this, he gets his additional income from pension funds. In his business, Samuel makes soaps and liquid detergents to sell in the surrounding areas.
He learned about Milango through friends and joined the organization with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. The challenges he faces are price fluctuation and inflation.
Samuel is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase raw materials to make soap. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand his business and further his studies. His future plans are to expand the business to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make soap.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children, three of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc., and the business has been operating for two years. Margaret started the business with her personal savings. 
Margaret learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.
Margaret is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, water, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, water, etc.

loans.name: Julyet

texts.es:
Julyet ha trabajado durante muchos años en la actividad de la venta de mercancía, y hace unos días abrió su propio negocio el cual es un almacén donde vende una gran variedad de productos como ropa, productos de uso personal y mucha variedad más. Pese a que lo ha montado con muy poco capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir poco a poco sacándolo adelante y así generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años. Como ha venido teniendo buenos pedidos, pero no tiene el capital suficiente para responder por ellos, Julyet busca un préstamo para comprar surtido ropa, productos de uso personal y mucha variedad más de mercancía y responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar adelante este negocio y aumentar los ingresos para su familia. Además ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y su hijo y poder tener las posibilidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Julyet has worked in retail for many years, and a few days ago, she opened her own shop in which she sells a variety of goods such as apparel, personal care products, and a wide variety of other merchandise. Despite the fact that she launched her business with very little capital, her hard work has allowed her to expand her shop little by little, thus earning the money she needs to cover the household expenses as she lives with her husband and 6-year-old son. Because she has received many orders from customers and does not have the working capital to fill them, Julyet is seeking a loan that will allow her to purchase more merchandise and meet customer demand.

Her dream is to make her business prosperous and increase the household earnings, as well as offer her husband and son a better quality of life so that they have the financial means to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to puchase clothes, personal use products, and more variety of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase material to make school uniforms for sale.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She owns a secondhand clothing shop, a business that she has been operating for one year. 
She learned about Milango through an employee and joined the company with the goal of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are customers who do not pay on time and the high purchase prices of the clothes.
Kibibi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase bales of secondhand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a grocery shop, a business which she has been operating for ten years. In this business, Kavumbi sells fish, fruits, etc.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the inconsistency of her suppliers. 
Kavumbi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase additional stock of farm produce such as potatoes for sale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the standard of living of her family. Her dream is to see her business grow to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of farm produce such as potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María Elizabeth de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos  de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su vivienda en una localidad muy concurrida de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela todos sus vecinos y las personas aledañas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, buenos precios y un servicio excelente; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor y se siente orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hasta el momento, quiere continuar su camino y esforzarse al máximo pues sabe que al final obtendrá una gran recompensa, el éxito; últimamente aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, huevos, bebidas etc. María Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth, 31, lives with her life partner and her children. She owns a store where she sells convenience store items: bulk grains, milk, eggs and bread, among others. She has several years of experience in the business and this has made her very familiar with sales which enables her to obtain the best profits. The store is located in María's home in an area that has heavy footfall, and she has obtained a lot of customers. All of her neighbors and the locals prefer her because she always has what they need with quality products, good prices and excellent service. 

María is a woman committed to her work and she feels proud of what she has achieved to date. She is keen to continue along her path and make every effort as she knows that in the end she will obtain a great reward: success. Recently demand has risen and she wants to make the most of it to grow the business and make a new investment, but she needs capital which is why she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to allow her to buy bulk grains, instant products, sweets, bread, eggs, drinks and so on. María Elizabeth has good payment references and is responsible, she says that she will be able to repay the loan and at the same time, she has faith that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: bulk grains, instant products, sweets, bread, eggs and drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 34, is presently at university. She is living together with her friend in Congo Town. She has three children. Two of the children are presently in school, while the oldest child has completed high school. For the past fifteen years, she has been selling body spray, men's cologne, body cream, hand cream, face makeup, and many other items. Her friend helped her start the business, and she learned sales from her sister. She is proud of her business because she makes profit when she sells products. With the profit she buys goods to improve her business and contribute toward the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body spray, men's cologne, body cream, and hand cream to increase her sales. Her plan for the
future is to build a big store to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, men's cologne, body cream, and hand cream to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en: Sabas is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old and married. Sabas has managed a transportation service business for 11 years. He earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Sabas joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Marly

texts.en: Marly is married with kids. She is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marly is a farmer and manages a gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earn 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Marly been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Marly hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad que aprovechando la experiencia que tiene de haber trabajado en una distribuidora de productos de la canasta familiar durante muchos años, decidió montar su propio negocio con unos pequeños ahorros que tenía. En un principio el negocio del comercio mayorista lo hacía con unos pocos clientes que había en su sector, y como no contaba con mucho capital disponible no podía abastecer a todos sus clientes. Con mucho esfuerzo ha venido sacando su negocio adelante y ahora tiene la oportunidad de tener más clientes, pero como sigue teniendo dificultades de capital, Alejandro busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar al por mayor y abastecer las ventas mayoristas con sus clientes.

Su sueño es convertirse en un gran proveedor para aumentar sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a young entrepreneur who is 23 years of age. After working many years for a company that distributes household products, he decided to start his own business with some of his savings. His wholesale business had very few customers at first because he did not have much available capital to supply all of them. Through great effort, he was able to move his business forward and now he has the opportunity to gain more customers. However, he continues to have difficulties obtaining capital.

Alejandro is requesting a loan so that he can buy household goods in bulk so that he can sell them wholesale to his customers. His dream is to become a successful distributor so that he can increase his earnings and provide his parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy household goods in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and flooring

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbambu est entrepreneur dynamique, leader du groupe d’affaire Ufalme, âgée d’environ 44 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants parmi les quels, deux ont leurs propres foyers et sept vont encore à l’école. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire dans l’administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse de jus local communément appelé Madrakwa. Il ya plusieurs années qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser  13 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. Sa famille  vit de cette activité d’autant plus que les fonctionnaires de l’Etat congolais ne sont pas régulièrement payés et quand ils sont payés, ils reçoivent de rémunération très médiocre qui ne leurs permet pas de couvrir l’ensemble de tout le mois ni de faire des économies ni de réaliser une épargne. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec les matières premières pour la fabrication de ce jus mandrakwa (5 sacs maïs, 50 kg millet, 50 kg farine, 50 kg sorgho, bois de chauffage, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser son entreprise et scolariser dignement ses enfants. La cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes non bancables.Il sied de signaler que, l’une des clientes porte un bébé au dos.
texts.en:
Mbambu, age 44, is a dynamic entrepreneur and leader of the Ufalme business group. She is a married mother of nine children, two of whom live on their own and the other seven still in school. Her spouse is a civil servant employed by the public administration. 

Mbambu sells a local juice commonly known as "Mandrakwa". She has been in this line of work for many years. She has completed 13 loan cycles with Hekima’s microfinance program. Her family lives on the earnings generated by her business, as the Congolese civil servants are paid sporadically and rather poorly, which does not enable them to cover the month's expenditures, let alone build savings. 

Mbambu will use this new loan to buy the ingredients needed to make Mandrakwa (5 sacks of maize, 50 kg of millet, 50kg of flour, 50kg of sorghum, some firewood, etc.). She also aims to sustain her business and to ensure that her children get a proper education. 

Mbambu would like to thank the Hekima MFI for helping impoverished women who are excluded from traditional banking channels. 

Note: One of the group members is carrying her baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make Mandrakwa juice (5 sacks of maize, 50 kg of millet, 50kg of flour, 50kg of sorghum, some firewood, etc.).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 41 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, ella vive junto a su madre quien le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su hijo quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Silvia es costurera y trabaja elaborando uniformes y ropa para adultos y niños, ella ha trabajado durante mucho años de esta manera lo que la hace una profesional en área contando con la confianza de las personas. Silvia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar zippers, botones, hilos de colores y otros más para elaborar más prendas de vestir con lo que espera mejorar sus ganancias y vivir mejor.
texts.en: Silvia, 41, is a very hardworking, responsible person.  She lives with her mother who helps her with the housework and with her son who helps her with household expenses.  Silvia’s a seamstress working making uniforms and clothes for adults and children.  She has worked this way for many years which makes her a professional in the field and which has won over people’s trust.  Silvia’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy zippers, buttons, thread in assorted colors and others to make more articles of clothing she hopes will improve her income to live better.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other sewing supplies to make clothes.

loans.name: Grover Benito

texts.es: El Sr. Grover  tiene 37 años y es casado con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de doce años, el se dedica a la carpintería  desde hace ya doce años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también se dedica a la carpintería su carpintería se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Grover utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de madera, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este su material de trabajo, ya que la falta de esto no le permite realizar su trabajo en  cantidad, El Sr. Grover  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es ser uno de los mejores carpinteros y realizar obras de buena calidad y así de esta manera mejorar la venta y por ende sus ganancias, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Grover is 37 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old child. He has engaged in carpentry for 12 years and learned this trade from his father who was also a carpenter. Grover’s carpentry shop is located in his home.

This loan is his first with Emprender. Sr. Grover will use the loan to buy wood. The reason why he is requesting this loan is because he lacks the capital to buy work materials, which is preventing him from completing a number of jobs. In his business, Grover faces challenges that keep him from overcoming poverty. He will utilize the benefits of this loan to improve his quality of life and that of his family. His wish is to become one of the best carpenters and produce work that is of good quality. This will improve his sales and his earnings since this business is the only source of income by which he is able to support himself and his family. He is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es: Juana Margarita de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su familia, ella posee un molino, muele maíz, frijol, tomate, entre otros tiene varios años de poseer el negocio y ya tiene mucha experiencia en el servicio, lo que le permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, el molino esta ubicado en su residencia y es muy conocido en toda la localidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el servicio es de calidad y los precios bajos; Juana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y muy trabajadora siempre esta buscando las alternativas que le ayuden a encontrar el camino al éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograr lo que tanto desea, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda en el mollino y han tenido algunas fallas con la maquina por lo que necesitan repararla para mejorar su servicio, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita reparar el motor de la maquina. Juana Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, es muy responsable por eso asegura que cancelara la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar una vida plena.
texts.en:
Juana Margarita, 24, lives with her family. She owns a mill, grinding corn, beans and tomatoes, among others. She has owned the business for several years and already has a lot of experience in the service which has enabled her to always obtain the best profits. The mill is found in her home and Juana is well-known in the whole town. She has obtained a large customer base because of the quality of the service and the low prices. 

Juana is a woman dedicated to her job; she is energetic and very hardworking. She is always looking for alternatives which help her on the road to success and she does not plan on giving up until she achieves what she so greatly wants. 

In the last few months, the demand in the mill has increased, and there have been a few machine break-downs. This is why it needs to be repaired to improve the service; however Juana Margarita doesn't have enough capital explaining why she seeks a loan from INTEGRAL that enables her to repair the machine engine. 

Juana Margarita has good repayment references from her acquaintances, she is very responsible which is why she says that she will repay the loan within the set period and at the same time, she hopes that she will enable her home to lead a full life.

loans.use: to repair an engine for a machine.

loans.name: Ada Alicia

texts.es: Ada de 56 años de edad, vive junto a dos hijos quienes dependen por completo de ella. Ada trabaja comercializando vestidos, faldas, blusas, ropa para bebé y más, su negocio está ubicado en un mercado y es muy conocida en la zona por vender a precios accesibles las prendas de vestir lo que le permite contar con varios clientes. Ada solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder surtir su negocio comprando roda de cama, cortinas y ropa para mujeres y hombres que esté de moda y así llamar la atención de más personas y hacer crecer su clientela. Esto será muy positivo para Ada ya que así percibirá más ganancias.
texts.en:
Ada, 56, lives with her two children who are completely dependent on her.  She works selling dresses, skirts, blouses, baby clothes and others.  Her business is located in a market and she’s very well-known in the zone for selling clothes at affordable prices which has brought her many customers.

Ada is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to stock her business.  She will buy bed linens, curtains and clothe for women and men that’s in style to catch more people’s eye thus expanding her clientele.  This will be very positive for Ada in that she’ll earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles de 31 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora que como toda madre y esposa responsable desea darle lo mejor a su familia, ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas. María trabaja vendiendo cremas para el cuerpo, ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, champú, gel para manos y otros productos más los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante y por catálogo. Este es un trabajo bastante agotador ya que debe caminar varias cuadras para ofrecer sus productos que en su mayoría comercializa a crédito, razón por la que solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza y así poder ofrecer más a sus clientes, haciendo crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles, 31, is a cheerful, hardworking woman who like all responsible mothers and wives wants to give the best to her family.  She lives with her husband and two daughters.

María works selling body creams, clothes, perfume, cosmetics, shampoo, hand gel and other products she sells both from place to place and via catalogue.  This is quite exhausting work because she must walk several blocks offering her goods which she sells on credit for the most part which is why she’s asking for a loan to have the money needed to buy beauty products to have to offer her customers thus making the business grow.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee and nutritional supplements to sell.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина торгует на местном центральном рынке. У нее - 2 роллета: один роллет с посудой - кастрюли, сковородки, чашки, ножи, формы для выпечки, а второй -  с галантерейными товарами - сумки, шапки, кошельки. 
Галина часто совершает поездки в Одессу и Харьков за товаром, где делает закупки на оптовых базах. Этот кредит понадобился Галине для очередной закупки кастрюль и сковородок под реализацию.
texts.en: Galina works at the local central market. She has two sections: one with dishes - pots, pans, cups, knives, baking forms - and a second with accessories - bags, hats, wallets. She often makes trips to Odessa and Kharkov to purchase goods at distribution centers, and she needs this loan for routine purchase of pots and pans.

loans.use: to purchase pots and pans

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна торгует женскими джинсами, брюками, штанами. Ее торговая точка находится на рынке для малоимущих – то есть людей с низким уровнем дохода. Этот рынок – очень крупный и там всегда большая проходимость людей, а, значит, и высокий покупательский спрос. 
Кредит понадобился Татьяне для того, чтобы осуществить закупку джинсов на осень с начесом с внутренней стороны, а также утепленных брюк и штанов. Зимы в Украине – всегда холодные и снежные, поэтому такой товар всегда пользуется хорошим спросом, особенно, когда на улице холодает.
texts.en:
Tatyana sells women's jeans, pants, and trousers from her stall in a discount market - a market for low income earners. The market is very big and always full of people. Hence, there is a high consumer demand. 

Tatyana needs this loan in order to purchase fleece-lined jeans for fall as well as warm pants and trousers. Ukrainian winters are always cold and snowy, so, these items are in demand, especially when it starts to get cold outside.

loans.use: to purchase fleece-lined jeans and warm pants

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián de sesenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, pan, huevos, leche, etc. tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas lo cual le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esa ubicada en su residencia y es muy conocida en la localidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a muy buen precio pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Sebastián es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su labor pues sabe que solo así logrará el éxito,  en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, pan, golosinas, etc. Sebastián tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable y asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la ve confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sebastián, who is 63 years old, lives with his wife and children in his own home. He owns a store where he sells products of daily consumption like basic grains, bread, eggs, milk, etc. He has had this business for a few years and it has given him good experience in sales, which has allowed him to increase his income. The store is located in his home, and is well known in the area. He has many customers and is preferred by many because he carries high quality products, has good prices and above all provides excellent service.   

Sebastián is an entrepreneur with a strong desire to get ahead. He puts all of his strength into his work because he knows it is the only way he will be successful. In the last few weeks the demand for items in his store has increased. He wants to make an investment to increase his stock and take advantage of the increase in demand, but he does not have the necessary capital to do so. That is why he has requested a loan through INTEGRAL, so that he can buy basic grains, instant food products, bread, snacks, etc. Sebastián has good credit references, is very responsible and promises to pay off the loan. He is confident that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant food products, bread and snacks.

loans.name: Gina Arely

texts.es: Gina vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos, ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres y también comercializa ropa interior. Su venta la realiza de forma ambulante, teniendo 20 años de hacer esta actividad. Gina solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de la casa en que reside, así mismo para comprar materiales de construcción para elaborar una pared y así también mejorar las condiciones de esta. Gina cuenta con muchas ilusiones de vivir mejor en su casa propia y también vivir cómoda y tranquila junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Gina lives with her husband and three children.  She works selling clothes for children, men and women and she also sells underwear.  She sells from place to place and has been doing this for 20 years.  

Gina is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have the money she needs to buy the house she lives in and also to buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall and make some home improvements.  Gina has great hopes of living better with her family in a house of her own and also to live comfortably and with peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to buy a house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es muy trabajadora y responsable, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Ella trabaja muy duro elaborando pan dulce y salado en su propia panadería la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, su negocio es bastante estable, por lo que desea surtirlo y mejorarlo lo más posible. Marina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los materiales necesario para elaborar el pan como: harina, azúcar, mantequilla, manteca, dulce y otros más y así también para comprar moldes, batidoras y todo lo necesario para agilizar el proceso de elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
Marina is very hardworking and responsible.  She lives with her husband and two minor children.  She works hard baking sweet and savory bread in her own home-based bakery.  The business is quite stable which is why she wants to stock it and improve it as much as possible.

Marina is asking for a loan through which she can buy all the necessary supplies like flour, sugar, butter, shortening, sweets and others to make the bread.  She also will buy molds, mixers and everything necessary to expedite the bread-making process.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 43 years old, is a married entrepreneur with 3 children from Catadman, Ozamis City, and she is earning from her transport service business. It was started almost 4 years ago now and she earn 8,000 PHP a month

To improve her business, she borrowed the amount of 17,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she just joined in 2010, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Sandra Veronica's Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias micro empresarias emprendedoras  de éxitos una de ellas es Sandra Verónica quien tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería desde hace dos años  fabrica muebles como ropero de tres cuerpos, sillas mecedoras, mesas, camas matrimoniales, camas unipersonales, sus trabajadores son sus hijos varones. Inicia su negocio con apoyo de su esposo y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta producir a escalas considerables. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maderas, lacas, selladores, barniz, lijas, junco. La otra socia es Silvia que vende ropa usada, Gisela tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising, successful micro businesswomen.  One of them is Sandra Verónica who has had a small carpentry shop for two years.  

She manufactures furniture like three-compartment armoires, rocking chairs, tables, full-size beds, twin beds.  Her sons do the work.  She started the business with support from her husband and it gradually grew until it became quite large-scale.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials like wood, lacquer, sealants, varnish, sandpaper and rush reeds.

The other members are Silvia who sells used clothes and Gisela who has a grocery store at home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood, lacquer, sealants and varnish.

loans.name: Grupo Real Sociedad Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cinco socios microempresarios de éxitos una de ellas es Josefa que se dedica a vender frutas esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 10 años, inicio con una mesita en su domicilio ella misma maneja su negocio, su sueño es tener un lugar estable fijo para ofrecer mejor variedad en su productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de frutas frescas, Juana vende frutas ambulante, Angelita vende frutas ambulantes también, Jerónima vende productos perecederos como chiltoma, tomate, cebolla etc., José Félix es artesano de madera típica como bambú lo cual hace mueble de ese material.
texts.en:
This group consists of five successful micro businesspeople.  Josefa is one of them and she works selling fruit.  She’s been doing this for ten years.  She started out with a little table outside her house.  She runs the business herself and her dream is to someday have a permanent place to sell a wider variety of products.  She will use the loan to buy fresh fruit.

Juana sells fruit from place to place and Angelita sells fruit from place to place too.  Jerónima sells perishable items like peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc. and José Félix is a craftsman working with traditional woods like bamboo; he makes furniture out of this material.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit.

loans.name: Mirian Esperanza

texts.es: Mirian Esperanza vive junto a sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas tiene varios años con el negocio y ha adquirida mucha experiencia en la elaboración y venta por lo que siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta un local ubicado en la comunidad donde vive y es muy transitado de personas, se hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo esta elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Mirian es una mujer ejemplar, decidida, dedicada a su labor y con muchas metas por delante, se siente orgullosa de lo que h logrado hasta el momento y esta segura que si continua trabajando con esfuerzo podrá alcanzar un éxito mayor, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión y no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón, verduras, etc. Mirian Esperanza tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mirian Esperanza lives with her three children, making her living selling tortillas and pupusas (thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). She has been working in this business for several years and have gained a lot of experience producing and selling where she always obtains healthy profits. 

The business is a store located in a community where Mirian lives and is frequented by a lot of people. She has a lot of steady customers who prefer her because everything is made with the best quality goods, at accessible prices and above all, an excellent service. Mirian is an exemplary woman, she is decisive, dedicated to her work and with a lot of goals for the future. She feels very proud of what she has achieved to date and is confident that if she continues working hard she will be able to achieve greater success.

In the last few weeks, demand has increase and she wants to profit from it by making a new investment and she doesn't have enough capital which is why she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL which enables her to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, pork crackling, vegetables and so on. Mirian Esperanza has good repayment references, she says that she will be able to repay the sum and at the same time has faith that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, pork crackling and vegetables.

loans.name: Khoem's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Khoem is a 59-year-old father of eight children, four of whom are dependent on him; one is still in school while the remaining one helps the family’s business.

To support the family, he has been farming rice and growing cassava and also complementing the income by raising cows. Having been involved in this business for 25 years, he can earn about 80,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for his paddy-field.

This is their first group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He and his group member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 400,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy insecticide and fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes this loan will fulfill his dream to grow his rice to become more productive and profitable so as to improve his standard of living and also keep his child in school.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Lady Marcela

texts.es:
Lady es una joven emprendedora de 25 años de edad que aprendió la actividad de la confección desde muy pequeña gracias a que su madre se la enseñó para trabajar a su lado. Desde hace un tiempo su madre se vio en la obligación de dejar de trabajar por dificultades de salud y así heredó el taller de confección a Lady, quien con estos ingresos puede sostener su hogar ya que es madres soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 8 años de edad. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus confecciones, tiene la oportunidad de generar 3 empleos en su taller, y como no cuenta con mucho capital para poder responder a los pedidos que tiene actualmente de sus clientes, Lady busca un préstamo para comprar materias primas como telas, hilos, agujas y otros para confeccionar los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar adelante este taller aumentando la producción para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder generar empleo para más personas. Además, poder sacar su familia adelante brindándole a su madre la posibilidad de mejor salud y a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lady is a young entrepreneur who is 25 years of age. She learned how to sew as a little girl thanks to her mother, who taught her how to work by keeping her by her side.

Some time ago, her mother felt obligated to pass on the business because of health problems. As a result, Lady inherited the sewing workshop. This source of income enables her to maintain her home since she is a head of household and a single mother of an eight-year-old son. Thanks to the high quality of work that she produces, Lady had the opportunity to create three jobs in her workshop.

She does not have much capital to respond to the requests she currently receives from her customers, so Lady is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials such as fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies that she needs to fulfill large orders. Her dream is to move forward with her workshop and increase production so that she can improve her earnings. As a result, Lady will be able to create jobs for more people. In addition, she will be able to move her family her forward and provide her mother the opportunity to improve her health and her son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: María Lucia vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus hijos y sus nietos en casa propia; ella posee una tortillería desde hace ya varios años, ha adquirido gran experiencia en la elaboración y venta y eso le ha permitido obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy visitado por las personas del lugar que la conocen, porque elabora las tortillas mas ricas y con el servicio mas rápido de la comunidad por la mañana y tarde, además toda su clientela la prefiere por la calidad y los buenos precios; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo y esta orgullosa porque sabe que pronto alcanzara el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción, pero para ello necesita invertir y no posee de suficiente capital propio, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc. María Lucia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura cancelará la deuda y a la vez confía que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María Lucía lives with her life partner, children, and grandchildren in her own house.  She has had a tortilla business for several years now.  She got a lot of experience making and selling them, which always has allowed her to earn excellent profits.

Her business, located in her home, is very popular with people in the area who know her because she makes the best tortillas and has the fastest service in the neighborhood, morning and afternoon.  Her customers also prefer her because of the quality and good prices of her products.

María is an active woman who is dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  Every day she makes the maximum effort in her work, and she's proud because she knows that soon she'll have the success she wants so much.

Demand has gone up in the past few weeks and she wants to make the most of it to increase production.  She needs to invest but she doesn't have sufficient capital of her own.  For this reason she's asking Integral for a loan to buy corn wholesale, propane gas, etc.

María Lucía has a good payment record and impeccable moral character.  She's certain she will pay back the debt and also trusts she'll bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and propane gas

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
Maria Amparo cuando fue abandonada por su esposo decidió comenzar un negocio de venta de productos de uso personal para poder sostener los ingresos de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos. En un principio las dificultades económicas de su hogar eran muy fuertes, pero con su esfuerzo ha podido ir sacando poco a poco su negocio adelante. Ahora, Maria Amparo busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para la temporada donde sus ventas se incrementan considerablemente.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio y sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
When her husband abandoned her, Maria Amparo decided to start her own business of selling personal use products so that she could generate household income to support her two children. The financial difficulties she faced at home were very tough, but through her efforts, she was able to move her business forward little by little.

Maria Amparo is now seeking a loan so that she can buy personal use products and restock her business in time for the season when her sales increase considerably. Her dreams are to have a successful business and to help her children move forward by providing them a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Saydaly

texts.ru: Сайдали родился 1989 года. В 1997 году поступил в школу и в 2008 году успешно окончил. После окончания школы он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции факультет таможенное дело. Данное время перешел на 5 курс. Он очень способный молодой человек. Сайдали увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает классическую литературу. Его родители занимаются скотоводством и не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в этом году. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en:
Saydaly was born in 1989. He started school in 1997 and successfully completed his primary education in 2008. After finishing school, Saydaly was accepted to Tadjik State University of Commerce in the Department of Commerce and Customs. He is currently in his fifth year. He is a very talented young man, who participates in sports and reads classical literature in his free time. 

Saydaly's parents work in animal husbandry and cannot afford to pay for his university tuition this year. So, he is requesting this loan to pay for it. Together let's help this young specialist finish his degree and realize his goals for the future. He is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To pay his university tuition

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина торгует мужской и женской одеждой в большом местном торговом центре, а также у нее есть точка в одном из магазинов на центральном рынке города.  
Финансовая помощь понадобилась Ирине для осенней закупки товара - женской и мужской одежды. Она планирует закупить женские кофты, свитера, мужские джинсы, спортивные штаны, а также ветровки.
texts.en:
Irina sells men’s and women’s clothing at a big local shopping center. She also has a sales outlet at the central market of her town.
Irina needs financial support in order to stock up on fall merchandise—women’s and men’s clothing. She plans to buy  women’s cardigans, sweaters, men’s jeans, sports pants and also wind jackets.

loans.use: to buy  women’s cardigans, sweaters, men’s jeans, sports pants and  wind jackets.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Battambang province, Sern, 26, is a married father of one dependent daughter who is still too young for school. Farming rice and growing cassava on a 1.5-hectare area of farmland are the main source of the family’s income, a business which he has been in for two years. To supplement the income, he also works for others in the local area for a fee. His daily income is approximately 20,000 KHR and he manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The scarcity of working capital is the main challenge for his rice-paddy.

Sern has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans, which were fully paid back, have relieved his family’s burden and improved their livelihood. Now he and his group member are applying for a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR and 4,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Sern will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his rice and cassava cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. He hopes this loan will enable his crop yield to become more profitable so as to sell it for a good price and fulfill his dream to expand his plantation business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice and cassava cultivated land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: 03-03-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Ms. Lưu has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy, biscuits, fruit and dry food to resell.  Lưu is 55 years old and she is single with 2 children.

Lưu is the group leader of the 03-03-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.  She has no dependents as her children are grown up.

This is Lưu's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Lưu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lưu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lưu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase candy, biscuits, fruit and dry food to resell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina toda su vida ha tenido que atravesar por grandes adversidades para poder sacar sus hijos y su propio hogar adelante, sin embargo siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy luchadora y buscar salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Madre soltera de 3 hijos, pues el padre de sus hijos la abandonó cuando eran muy pequeños, a Luz Marina le ha tocado realizar diferentes labores para poder sostener su hogar; y después de muchos años trabajando en diferentes oficios, hace unos años montó desde su casa una tienda general la cual le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos y ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Como no cuenta con un capital suficiente en su negocio y aspira a poder superar estas dificultades económicas, Luz Marina acude a un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio con mayor variedad de productos que sus clientes le están solicitando.

Su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda en la cual sus ingresos mejoren considerablemente y pueda ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina has gone through great adversities her entire life in order to support her children and move her home forward.  Nevertheless, she’s always been noted for being very tenacious and for looking for ways to continue forward with much effort.

She’s a single mother of three children because her children’s father abandoned them when they were still very little and Luz Marina has had to do different types of work in order to support her home.

After many years of working in a variety of jobs, a few years ago she set up a small grocery store at home that’s made it possible for her to earn higher income and provide her three children with better quality of life.  

Because she does not have sufficient capital in her business and she hopes to overcome these economic difficulties, Luz Marina is calling on a loan to buy basic staple items to stock her store with a wider variety of goods her customers are requesting.

Her dream is to be able to have a large store that will considerably improve her income so she can offer her three children better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina  “El Progreso” están en el sexto ciclo y tiene   16  integrantes, ellas se destacan por la unión y por su trabajo, salen adelante gracias a su gran labor y la ayuda que se san las unas a las otras.
Anastacia es la presidenta, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Tiene una despensa bien surtida, y cuenta que con el correr del tiempo ha ido creciendo y mejorando y que quiere seguir haciéndolo.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra bebidas, verduras, carnes, y demás productos de primera necesidad para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called “El Progreso” (Progress) and it’s in the sixth cycle with 16 members.  They stand out because of their unity and work.  They get ahead thanks to their hard work and the help they provide each other.

Anastacia is the president.  She’s a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and help her family by means of her work.  She has a well-stocked grocery store and she relates that as time has passed it’s been growing and improving and she wants it to continue to do so.

She’s requesting this loan to buy beverages, vegetables, meat and other basic staples in order to be able to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, meat and other products.

loans.name: 06-03-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đợi has a retail business selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  Đợi is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Đợi is the group leader of the 06-03-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Đợi supports 2 dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Đợi's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Đợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đợi faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Đợi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district of Cambodia, Kean is 54 years old and married. She has five children. 

The main sources of family income are from farming rice and growing cassava, which she has been engaged in for twenty years. She can earn approximately 27,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The low price for cassava at the market is the main challenge. 

Kean has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other members are the first-cycle clients with VisionFund. She fully paid back the loan and it has helped her to maintain her production on time. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rice plantation business. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive and profitable so as to sell it for a high price in order to better her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rice plantation business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita of Labo, Ozamis City has been raising pigs for more than 3 years and earns 2,000 per month. She’s 55 years old now yet continues to hang on with her piggery to provide for her 3 children. She been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In order to enhance her livestock for selling, she is borrowing an amount of PHP 2,500 from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Florita hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for her piggery.

loans.name: Faver Alexander

texts.es:
Faver aprendió la actividad de la reparación de electrodomésticos desde muy joven y así consiguió empleo con el cual aportaba económicamente para su hogar, ya que sus padres eran muy pobres y tenían grandes necesidades económicas. Con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo cada vez más de la actividad hasta que un día decidió montar su propio negocio y trabajar de manera independiente, buscando progresar financieramente. Hace 20 años que inició con su propio negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo ha superado grandes dificultades del camino, hasta el punto que ahora su esposa le colabora en el taller para poder responder a todos los pedidos de los clientes. Con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de los clientes, Faver busca un préstamo para comprar repuestos que necesita y así seguir cumpliendo a los pedidos de los clientes.

Su sueño es salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su hijo de 1 años. Además sueña con poder comprarse su casa propia y ofrecer un hogar estable para su familia.
texts.en:
Faver learned how to repair household appliances as a young man and continued in this line of work in order to financially support his household. His parents were very poor and had great financial needs. As time passed, he gained more knowledge on the job and one day decided to start his own business so that he could work independently and progress financially.

Faver started his business 20 years ago. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to overcome great hardships in life. His wife now works alongside him in his shop by responding to the requests from all of his customers. In order to meet the demands of his customers, Faver is seeking a loan so that he can buy the spare parts that he needs to fulfill the requests of his customers.

His dream is to move forward and improve the quality of life of his wife and their one-year-old son. In addition, he dreams of buying a house of his own so that he can provide a stable home for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 6 años de edad ya que el padre de su hijo la abandonó hace un tiempo dejándola a cargo de todas las responsabilidades del hogar. Como conseguir un empleo era muy difícil, además de que debía cuidar su hijo porque no tiene quién se lo cuide, Maria Eugenia encontró la oportunidad de generar sus ingresos con la venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, donde sus principales clientes son sus familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector. La gran dificultad que no le ha permitido seguir creciendo con su negocio es la falta de capital suficiente para responder a todos los grandes pedidos que le hacen, y es por esto que para superar esta dificultad Maria Eugenia busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal y así poder responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un local comercial donde pueda mejorar sus ingresos y también pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a single mother, head of household.  She has a six-year-old son.  Her son’s father abandoned them some time ago leaving all the home’s responsibilities in her hands.  

Because finding employment was very difficult and besides she had to care for her son because there’s no one else to do so, María Eugenia found a way to generate her own income by selling personal use products via catalogue.  Her main customers are family members, neighbors and friends in the area.  

The great difficulty that’s kept her from growing in her business is the lack of capital sufficient to fill all the large customer orders she has pending and it’s in order to overcome this that María Eugenia is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy personal use products and be able to fill pending customer orders.

Her dream is to have a commercial locale someday so she can improve her income and also provide employment for people most in needs.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to fill pending customer orders.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.ru:
Зоя торгует на одном из самых крупных вещевых рынков, а также в местном Торговом доме. У нее - 3 торговые точки. Зоя реализует женскую одежду: женские кофты, блузы, пиджаки, юбки, штаны. Торговая точка Зои очень удачно расположена на рынке, где покупатели не пройдут мимо. К тому же Зоя - очень вежливая женщина, порядочная, всегда находится на своем торговом месте.
Эта сумма понадобилась Зое для очередной поездки в Харьков для увеличения ассортимента товара и закупки женских осенних кофт и пиджаков.
texts.en: Zoya works in one of the biggest flea markets, as well as in a local shopping mall.  She has three trading points and she sells women's clothing: blazers, jackets, skirts and pants.  Her trading points are very well-positioned in high-traffic areas of the market.  Zoya herself is a very polite woman who is organized and always in her trading stall.  She needs this loan to make a routine trip to Kharkiv to increase her range of goods and to buy women's jackets and blazers for fall.

loans.use: to buy women's autumn jackets and blazers.

loans.name: 03-05-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Đào is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for resale in the future. Đào has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Đào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Đào is 57 years old and has no dependents. She works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Đào is the group leader of the 03-05-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. This is Đào's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for resale in the future.

loans.name: Naysi's Group

texts.en:
Naysi, age 45, is a farmer living in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Naysi has five children, three of whom are students and still under her responsibility. To provide for her household, she has been engaged in growing cassava on two-hectares of farmland for twenty-five years. The current business earns her about 24,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
Naysi’s group is requesting their first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KR each. As the group leader, she is going to utilize her portion to buy fertilizer for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava fruitfully and healthfully so as to sell it for a high price in order to make a living better in her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Choum

texts.en:
Choum is 48 years and married. Her family lives in a rural area of the Kror kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has nine children, four of whom are dependent and still in school. She has earned a living through farming rice on a five-hectare area of farmland for twenty-two years. Her husband also supplements the income by making palm-sugar.

Insufficient water supply is the main challenge for her paddy-field business. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Choum is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to build on her savings to buy a proper tractor for helping her in the rice-field. She hopes this mini-tractor will help her in rice-field so as to grow her rice fruitfully and timely.

loans.use: To buy a proper tractor for helping her in the rice-field

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng, 49, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are students in the local public area. To make a living, she has farmed rice on two-hectares of farmland for seven years and supplements her income by serving breakfast in the local area. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient water supply for her paddy is the main challenge for her business. 

Kheng has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid back the past loans while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has wisely used the past loans to better support her family's livelihood and sustain her business. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to utilize her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and split a portion of it to spend on buying spices to supporting her breakfast-serving business. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice timely and fruitfully and increase her income so as to better her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets and other linens she needs and to repair the dampness in one of the rooms.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years-old and married with 2 children. To make a living, Vivian has cultivated coconuts for 12 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

Vivian joined GDMPC in 2008. Vivian is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to fund her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en: Pablo is from Nagrumbuan. He is 50 years old and is married with six children. He works hard to give his family a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and will allow him to support his children and extended family. Pablo has been engaged in farming. He usually plants and harvests rice and the sells it to buyers. According to him, the income from his business will help him to cope with the needs of his family. Thus, Pablo wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 45,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested for the further growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad que adquirió el gusto por las salas de belleza de su madre quien siempre se dedicó a esta actividad. Como aprendió desde muy temprano, hace un tiempo decidió abrir un salón de belleza propio y así inició con su propio negocio el cual lo enfocó hacia la atención de niños porque en el sector no había un negocio así. Con mucho esfuerzo ha venido superando las dificultades de capital que tiene en su negocio y ahora que tiene buenas ventas, Luis Miguel busca un préstamo para comprar una silla de motilar en forma de carrito y una sala de espera para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor atención.

De esta forma podrá aumentar sus ventas por tener un negocio más atractivo y poco a poco seguirá progresando y sacando adelante sus padres que siempre han padecido dificultades económicas.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is a young entrepreneur who is 20 years of age. He acquired a liking for beauty salons since his mother was always in this line of work. Luis learned to work at a very young age and some time ago decided to open his own beauty salon. When he started his business, he decided to focus on providing children’s services since there was no other business like this in the area. Through great effort, he has been able to overcome difficulties resulting from the flow of capital into his business and now he has good sales.

Luis Miguel is seeking a loan so that he can buy a modular barber’s chair that is shaped like a small car and waiting room chairs so that he can offer better service to his customers. In this manner, he hopes to increase his sales and have a more appealing business. As a result, he hopes to continue making steady progress and assist his parents who have always faced financial difficulty.

loans.use: to buy a modular barber's chair and waiting room chairs.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que se caracteriza por querer ayudar a las demás personas, y esto le ha permitido ayudar a progresar a muchas personas de su sector que tenían grandes dificultades y ahora pueden contar con un empleo. Desde hace unos 17 años Maria montó un taller de confección en su casa buscando generar ingresos para aportar en su familia, y al ver que con este negocio le estaba yendo bien e iba creciendo, comenzó a generar empleo el cual lo ofrecía a las madres solteras cabezas de hogar de su sector. Ahora su taller es un taller de confección más grande donde tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a la escasez económica Maria busca un préstamo para comprar hilos, agujas, telas y realizar el mantenimiento que sus máquinas necesitan para confeccionar los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. 

Su sueño es seguir sacando adelante este taller de confección y continuar generando más empleo para las madres solteras cabezas de familia que necesitan de unos ingresos. Además, espera que en su hogar su esposo y sus 3 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is noted for wanting to help others which has led her to help many in her sector who were in dire straits and who now can count on having employment.  About 17 years ago María set up her sewing workshop at home looking for a way to generate family income.  

Seeing that the business was doing well and was growing, she started to generate employment that she’d offer to single mother, heads of household in her sector.  Now, her workshop is a larger shop and she has large customer orders.  However, due to María's limited economic resources she’s looking for financing to be able to buy thread, needles and fabric and to be able to service the sewing machines needed to fill her pending customer orders.

Her dream is to continue moving the workshop ahead and to continue generating more jobs for single mother, heads of household who need to earn income.  In addition, she hopes her home consisting of her husband and three children will have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
Maria aprendió la actividad de la preparación de comidas rápidas trabajando en un restaurante durante muchos años; y ya cuando se le terminó el contrato, con unos ahorros montó su propio puesto de venta de comidas rápidas al frente de su casa. Con este negocio puede seguir generando los ingresos que necesita en su hogar para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad. Ya lleva 6 meses con su propio puesto de venta de comidas rápidas y gracias a su esfuerzo y las extensas jornadas que trabaja, ha podido sacarlo adelante y superar las dificultades de capital que tiene en el negocio; sin embargo ahora que busca mejorar sus ventas, Maria acude a un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas rápidas y comprar gaseosas para ofrecer junto a las comidas.

Así espera aumentar sus ventas considerablemente y por ende los ingresos para su hogar. Su sueño es lograr ubicarse dentro de un local en el centro de la ciudad donde pueda tener mayores ingresos y así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Maria learned this trade of preparing fast food working in a restaurant for many years; when she finished her contract she set up her own fast food stall in front of her house with some savings. With this business she can continue generating the earnings that she needs in her home to get her children ahead who are 15 and 19 years old. She now has had her own food stall for six months and thanks to her efforts and the extensive hours that she works, she has been able to move forward and overcome the difficulties in obtaining capital for her business. However, she now looks to improve her sales. Maria would use the loan to buy supplies to prepare fast food and to buy soft drinks to offer alongside the food. 

In this way she hopes to considerably increase her sales and her household earnings. Her dream is to locate her stall in a locale in the downtown area of the city where she could have better earnings and offer a better quality life to her two children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare fast food and soft drinks to offer with her food.

loans.name: Kharitina

texts.ru:
Харитина торгует на крупном местном рынке, продает живые цветы и домашние растения. Ее торговая точка – цветочный павильон - работает круглосуточно. Расположен павильон очень удачно, место хорошо проходимое. Харитина - трудолюбива, постоянна в торговле, честная и добрая.
Дополнительные средства понадобились Харитине для очередной закупки живых цветов из Харькова.
texts.en: Kharitina works in a large local market where she sells live flowers and houseplants.  Her trading point, the flower pavilion, is open 24 hours a day.  The pavilion is in a very good, high-traffic location.  Kharitina is diligent, always at work, honest and pleasant.  She needs this loan to purchase her next batch of live flowers in Kharkiv.

loans.use: to buy a batch of live flowers wholesale in Kharkiv.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 41 years old and engaged in the hog-fattening business as his primary source of income. He is blessed with three children and it is hard for him to promote their living with all their needs, especially their education. Therefore, he usually feels he has insufficient funds.
